    • The software-based approach minimizes hardware costs by utilizing existing microcomputer resources.
    • The system is designed to ensure accurate protocol detection even in varying vehicle states.
    • The invention allows for a consistent user experience across different vehicle models.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles that incorporates an anti-dive device.
    * The system aims to reduce vertical vibrations and improve braking efficiency by controlling the front fork's contraction during braking.
    * It utilizes hydraulic pressure from the braking system to operate the anti-dive device, which dampens the front fork's movement.
    * The design includes a hydraulic pump, modulator, and pressure discharge valve to manage braking pressure and prevent wheel lock.

* The system features two embodiments with different anti-dive mechanisms.
    * The first embodiment uses a hydraulic relay chamber and a valve body that responds to hydraulic pressure from the master cylinder.
    * The second embodiment employs a braking torque-responsive anti-dive unit that adjusts based on the braking force applied.
    * Both designs aim to enhance the motorcycle's stability and braking performance by quickly increasing the load on the front wheel during braking.
</summary>

<summary>
* This application is a continuation of a provisional patent application.
    * Filed on July 20, 2000.
    * Complete disclosure is incorporated by reference.
    * Relates to movable partitions and panels.
* The invention addresses cargo separation during transport.
    * Focuses on multi-temperature transport for perishable items.
    * Aims to improve efficiency in refrigerated transport.
    * Reduces unnecessary strain on refrigeration units.
* Current refrigerated transport systems typically have a single large cargo space.
    * Cooling the entire space is often unnecessary and costly.
    * Increases fuel consumption and transportation costs.
    * Lengthens cooling time after temperature aberrations.
* Movable partitions and bulkheads are known solutions.
    * Allow division of cargo areas for multi-temperature transport.
    * Configurations vary for trailers, railcars, and containers.
    * Panels can be removed and stored when not in use.
* Insulated bulkheads separate cargo areas within trailers.
    * Enable transport of different temperature-sensitive goods.
    * May include walk-through doors for access.
    * Sometimes referred to as bulkheads due to functional similarities.
* The invention features an improved partition system.
    * Panels are independently attached to mounting assemblies.
    * Allows for independent movement of each panel.
    * Can define multiple cargo areas with varying temperatures.
* The system includes a rail and trolley mechanism.
    * Panels can slide and be raised into a stowed position.
    * Trolley assemblies allow for fore and aft movement.
    * Panels can be configured to open like household doors.
* Various modifications to the panel and rail system are possible.
    * Rails can be installed on side walls or ceilings.
    * Mounting mechanisms can vary to accommodate different designs.
    * Panels can be secured with straps, buckles, or locking pins.
* The design minimizes the rearward clearance needed for panel movement.
    * Allows for stowing even with cargo stacked close to the panel.
    * Enhances usability and efficiency in cargo management.
    * Panels can be used together or independently based on needs.
* The invention encompasses various embodiments and modifications.
    * Additional features can be integrated without departing from the invention.
    * The scope of the invention is defined by the following claims.
    * Encourages innovation in cargo transport solutions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention introduces a sanitizable rotary valve for liquid chromatography.
    • Designed for separating and purifying biological macromolecules in pharmaceuticals.
    • Allows for in-place sanitization without disassembly.
    • Utilizes a unique diaphragm-like elastomeric seal to retain sanitizing fluids.
    • Aims to prevent contamination and ensure sterile conditions during operation.

• Prior art lacks effective sanitizable rotary valves.
    • Existing rotary valves require disassembly for cleaning.
    • Non-rotary sanitizable valves do not meet the needs of liquid chromatography.
    • Previous designs do not allow for effective flushing of contact surfaces.
    • There is a clear need for improved sanitization methods in fluid handling systems.

• The valve features a novel design with a thermoplastic elastomeric diaphragm.
    • The diaphragm integrates multiple sealing ports for fluid connection.
    • It includes dynamic wipe sealing lips to maintain a fluid-tight seal.
    • The design minimizes the required sealing force to enhance diaphragm longevity.
    • Allows for periodic cleaning and sanitization while maintaining operation.

• The invention supports simulated moving bed (SMB) chromatography.
    • Enables efficient separation processes by simulating counter-current flow.
    • Incorporates multiple beds for optimal loading and regeneration of adsorbents.
    • Reduces eluent consumption and enhances product recovery.
    • Facilitates continuous operation without damaging pressure surges.

• The invention is applicable in various chromatography techniques.
    • Suitable for ion exchange, size exclusion, and affinity chromatography.
    • Can handle diverse biomolecules, including proteins and peptides.
    • Designed to improve economic efficiency in biotechnology separation processes.
    • Offers a reliable solution for maintaining sterile conditions in pharmaceutical manufacturing.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to improved gas-liquid contacting trays and valve-tray assemblies.
    * It focuses on enhancing efficiency through directional thrust valves and tray construction.
    * The design addresses issues of vapor-liquid contact and flow patterns in distillation columns.
    * The invention is a continuation of prior patents and builds on existing tray technologies.

* The tray configurations include cross-flow and counter-flow designs with various downcomer arrangements.
    * Downcomers direct liquid onto the tray, influencing the flow pattern and efficiency.
    * The active area of the tray is critical for effective vapor-liquid interaction.
    * Multiple downcomer trays (MD trays) are used for high liquid rates to increase bubbling area.
    * The design aims to minimize liquid backflow and maximize vapor disengagement.

* Sieve trays are highlighted for their effectiveness in vapor-liquid contact.
    * They feature numerous apertures that allow vapor to engage with liquid flowing across the tray.
    * The efficiency of sieve trays can be improved by managing froth height and minimizing weeping.
    * Froth enhances contact time between vapor and liquid, increasing separation efficiency.
    * Operating pressure affects vapor absorption in descending liquid, impacting overall performance.

* The invention proposes a novel valve design for improved vapor flow and liquid mixing.
    * The valve assembly includes a circular tray valve with support legs that direct liquid flow.
    * The design allows for selective biasing of the valve to facilitate vapor flow.
    * Various valve shapes, including oval and triangular, are considered for different applications.
    * The method enhances the mixing of vapor with liquid, improving overall column efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
* Background of the Invention
	* Fluid pressure regulators are commonly used in various applications, such as gas grills and medical devices.
	* Prior art regulators suffer from energy loss and high costs for significant pressure reductions.
	* The invention aims to convert potential energy into work and reduce the cost of pressure regulation.

* Summary of the Invention
	* The invention provides a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure.
	* It aims to reduce output pressure variances caused by large input pressure differences.
	* The assembly is designed to be lightweight, portable, and inexpensive to manufacture.

* Detailed Description of the Preferred Embodiment
	* The assembly includes a pressurized fluid source, a vane motor, and a fluid regulator.
	* The vane motor converts pressurized fluid into mechanical power, which can be used to generate electricity.
	* The fluid regulator manages the pressure before the fluid reaches the output line.

* Vane Motor Design
	* The vane motor features a casing with an inner drum and multiple vanes for efficient fluid movement.
	* The design minimizes drag and maximizes torque through the use of wear-resistant materials.
	* The motor can be adapted for various applications, including generating electricity or mechanical work.

* Alternative Embodiments
	* The invention can be adapted for use in vehicles powered by pressurized fluids.
	* It can also be integrated into scuba systems to recover energy from compressed air.
	* Multiple vane motors can be utilized for different functions, such as electricity generation and mechanical power.

* Advantages of the Invention
	* The assembly extracts work from pressurized fluid while simultaneously reducing its pressure.
	* It allows for the use of smaller, less expensive pressure regulators.
	* The design enhances efficiency and reduces costs in fluid pressure regulation systems.

* Flexibility and Modifications
	* The invention is not limited to the described embodiments and can accommodate various designs.
	* Different types of motors and generators can be employed based on specific needs.
	* The assembly can be customized for different pressures and applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to pallet systems designed for efficient loading and unloading while minimizing item shifting.
	* The system includes a pallet with raised guide rails that accommodate trays with side supports.
	* End stops and end plates are incorporated to restrict movement and enhance stability during transport.

* The pallet system allows for automated loading and unloading of trays.
	* Trays can be slid onto the pallet along the guide rails, with end stops preventing excessive movement.
	* The design supports interlocking of trays, providing additional stability.

* The pallet cap is customizable to fit various pallet sizes and shapes.
	* It features pockets that align with conventional pallet designs for secure placement.
	* The guide rails are designed to accommodate specific tray shapes, such as those for fragile items like eggs.

* The components of the pallet system can be manufactured from various plastics and through different methods.
	* The end plates and pallet cap can be produced using techniques like thermoforming and injection molding.
	* The design allows for nesting of components when not in use, optimizing storage space.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an electrically driven flying saucer utilizing magnetic suspension technology.
	* It aims to optimize the internal space of the saucer shell while ensuring high efficiency and safety.
* The rotary-wing system consists of magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, and a magnetic suspension shaft.
	* This system allows for the suspension and rotation of the wings without contact, reducing noise and vibration.
* Two configurations are proposed for the rotary-wing systems: coaxial axial dual and coaxial radial dual systems.
	* Both configurations help counteract reactive torque and enhance stability and power performance.
* The design incorporates advanced magnetic suspension principles, including the use of permanent magnets, electromagnets, or superconducting materials.
	* This enables effective control and stability of the flying saucer during operation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to streptavidin muteins with enhanced binding affinity for peptide ligands.
		• The muteins contain mutations in the amino acid positions 44 to 53 of streptavidin.
		• These modifications allow for improved isolation, purification, and detection of biological substances, particularly recombinant proteins.
• The binding affinity of the streptavidin muteins is significantly higher than that of wild-type streptavidin.
		• The increase in binding affinity can be at least a factor of 5, with some muteins showing improvements of 10 to 20 times.
		• The muteins can be used in various applications, including affinity chromatography and detection methods like ELISA and Western blot.
• The invention includes methods for producing these muteins and their use in various biological assays.
		• A process for transforming host cells with vectors containing the mutein coding sequences is described.
		• The resulting proteins can be labeled and utilized in detection and purification protocols.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention involves methods for forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts.  
    • The nickel catalyst is preferably in the zero oxidation state.  
    • Suitable nickel catalysts include nickel-boride and nickel-phosphide alloys.  
    • The methods aim for high yields and mild reaction conditions.  
    • The nickel catalyst can be reused after the reaction.  

• Guanidines are important in various biologically active compounds and drugs.  
    • They are fully protonated under physiological conditions, enhancing interactions with receptors.  
    • The guanidine group is found in drugs like anti-ulcer agents and cardiovascular medications.  
    • Efficient synthesis methods are crucial for pharmaceutical applications.  
    • The invention addresses the need for reduced reagent quantities and toxic byproducts.  

• The synthesis typically involves treating amines with guanylating agents.  
    • Common agents include thioureas and isothioureas.  
    • Previous methods often required excess reagents and longer reaction times.  
    • Toxic mercuric salts used in prior methods pose safety concerns.  
    • The invention seeks to eliminate these disadvantages.  

• Preferred reaction conditions include temperatures from -30 to 140°C.  
    • The reactions can be conducted in solvents like DMF, THF, and DMSO.  
    • High yields of guanidines can be achieved in short reaction times.  
    • The methods allow for the synthesis of various substituted guanidines.  
    • The use of protecting groups is emphasized for selective reactions.  

• Several examples demonstrate the effectiveness of the methods.  
    • Different nickel catalysts were tested, showing high yields.  
    • The guanylation of various amines was successfully achieved.  
    • The results indicate that nickel catalysts can be effective in catalytic amounts.  
    • The methods provide a practical approach for synthesizing guanidines in the pharmaceutical industry.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a method and apparatus for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires.
	* It involves anodic oxidation followed by electrolytic coloration to enhance weatherability and fade resistance.
* Traditional methods for coloring aluminum have limitations in durability and require significant electrical energy.
	* Existing techniques often result in poor weatherability and fading over time, making them unsuitable for certain applications.
* The inventors propose a novel apparatus that allows continuous anodic oxidation and coloring without direct power connection to the aluminum.
	* This method aims to reduce energy consumption while maintaining high-quality coloring.
* The anodic oxidation bath typically contains 10 to 55% sulfuric acid and may include additional salts or acids.
	* The desired thickness of the oxide film for effective coloring is between 4 to 15 microns.
* The electrolytic coloring bath can include various salts such as nickel, cobalt, copper, and tin, influencing the resulting color.
	* Different combinations of electrolytic conditions and bath compositions yield a range of colors.
* The apparatus includes multiple baths for degreasing, etching, anodizing, coloring, and sealing the aluminum strips or wires.
	* The process is designed for continuous operation, enhancing efficiency in production.
* Electric current control is achieved through rheostats, allowing adjustments in the anodic oxidation and coloring baths.
	* This flexibility helps maintain consistent quality and color during the coloring process.
* The invention allows for the use of various electrode materials depending on the electrolytic bath composition.
	* For example, nickel plates are preferred when using nickel salts in the coloring bath.
* The sealing treatment can involve boiling water or solutions containing inorganic salts to enhance durability.
	* This final step ensures the colored oxide films are protected and maintain their appearance over time.
* The overall design of the apparatus aims to produce aluminum strips or wires with superior weatherability and fade resistance at a low cost.
	* The industrial value of this continuous coloring method is significant due to its efficiency and effectiveness.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention describes a process for producing transgenic plants transformed on a chromosome.
    * It involves screening nucleotide sequences for desired phenotypes in plants.
    * The process allows for the integration of DNA sequences of interest into plant chromosomes.
    * It utilizes vectors that enable site-specific recombination for efficient transformation.
    * The invention also provides libraries of transgenic plants or seeds for various applications.

* Current methods of plant transformation are often time-consuming and limited in flexibility.
    * Traditional methods include Agrobacterium-mediated delivery and direct transformation techniques.
    * These methods face challenges such as low efficiency and complex integration patterns.
    * The invention aims to overcome these limitations by allowing in planta engineering of DNA sequences.
    * It enables the assembly of complex DNA sequences from simpler precursors, enhancing efficiency.

* The process allows for the modular use of vectors, reducing cloning work and overall vector size.
    * It facilitates the screening of DNA libraries for desired traits in plants.
    * The invention supports the production of stably transformed plants capable of expressing functions of interest.
    * It emphasizes the importance of using plant-origin sequences to avoid unnatural gene transfer.
    * The method can be applied to various plant species, including agronomically important crops.

* The invention provides a versatile approach for genetic transformation and functional genomics.
    * It allows for rapid optimization of sequences to be expressed in plants.
    * The process can be used for gene function analysis and directed evolution.
    * It addresses biosafety concerns by ensuring that transgenic plants do not transfer unnatural sequences.
    * The assembly of DNA sequences in planta can lead to the generation of diverse transgenic plants.
</summary>

<summary>
* Background of the Invention
    * The invention pertains to a swash plate type compressor for refrigerant gas.
    * It aims to reduce frictional wear by applying a fluorocarbon coating on swash plate surfaces.
    * The coating allows the use of lower-cost alloy materials while maintaining durability.
    * Increased durability and efficiency of the compressor are key benefits.

* Description of the Related Art
    * Swash plate compressors have been used in automotive air conditioning for years.
    * High friction occurs due to shear-type contact between the swash plate and piston shoes.
    * Existing coatings, like those described in U.S. Pat. No. 5,056,417, have limitations under high friction loads.
    * There is a need for a coating that is both friction-reducing and highly durable.

* Summary of the Invention
    * The invention features a rotary shaft with an aluminum swash plate coated with a polyfluoro elastomer.
    * The coating includes lubricious and load-bearing additives for enhanced performance.
    * It eliminates the need for expensive high-silicon aluminum materials.
    * The coating is applied via an aqueous spray and cured at elevated temperatures.

* Detailed Description of the Preferred Embodiments
    * The compressor consists of a cylinder block with reciprocating pistons.
    * The swash plate is mounted on a rotating shaft and interacts with pivoting shoes.
    * The coating process allows for roughened surfaces to enhance adhesion.
    * The coating can be applied without requiring high surface finishes.

* Experimental Results
    * Coated swash plates show significantly improved seizure loads compared to uncoated ones.
    * The polyfluoro elastomer coating provides a low coefficient of friction.
    * Curing times and temperatures affect the durability of the coating.
    * Non-hypereutectic aluminum swash plates perform equally well as hypereutectic ones with the coating.

* Conclusion
    * The invention provides a cost-effective solution for swash plate compressors.
    * It enhances durability and efficiency while reducing manufacturing complexity.
    * The coating's mechanical and chemical bonding improves performance.
    * Future modifications can be made without departing from the invention's spirit.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces novel organic polymers for anti-reflective coatings in semiconductor photolithography.
    * These polymers are designed to absorb light at 193 nm and 248 nm wavelengths.
    * They prevent light reflection and standing wave effects during the manufacturing of DRAM devices.
    * The polymers can be synthesized from various resins and diazonaphthoquinone halides.
    * The resulting anti-reflective coatings are spectroscopically stable and improve yield in semiconductor pattern formation.

* The invention also details preparation methods and compositions for these anti-reflective coatings.
    * The coatings can include additional light-absorbing compounds to enhance performance.
    * The preparation involves dissolving the polymers in organic solvents and applying them to silicon wafers.
    * Hard-baking the coatings cross-links the polymers, rendering them insoluble and effective.
    * The methods aim to eliminate issues like cutting or footing during pattern formation in photolithography.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention presents a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable film made from crystallizable thermoplastics, with a thickness of 10 to 350 μm.
	• The film incorporates white pigments, flame retardants, and UV absorbers, ensuring good mechanical and optical properties while being cost-effective to produce.

• The film is designed for outdoor applications, maintaining its properties without yellowing or embrittlement over time, and can be produced using standard industrial processes.
	• It meets fire safety standards (DIN 4102 and UL 94) and exhibits excellent thermoformability, allowing for complex moldings without the need for predrying.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention presents a method for producing 1,1,1-trifluoroethane (143a).
    • The process involves continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane (142b).
    • High conversion and selectivity rates (over 99%) are achieved.
    • The method utilizes heterogeneous catalysis, specifically chromium-based catalysts.
    • The process avoids undesirable byproducts and is economically feasible for industrial applications.

• Previous methods for synthesizing 143a had limitations.
    • Many existing processes resulted in low yields or required toxic reagents.
    • Batch processes were less efficient compared to the continuous method proposed.
    • Some catalysts required long regeneration times, making them impractical.
    • The new method addresses these issues by providing a simpler and more effective approach.

• The reactor design allows for effective reaction conditions.
    • The process can be conducted at temperatures between 100° C. and 400° C.
    • The molar ratio of HF to 142b is critical for minimizing byproduct formation.
    • The reactor can be operated under adiabatic conditions for efficiency.
    • Various catalyst supports can be used, enhancing flexibility in the process.

• The invention includes detailed experimental examples demonstrating effectiveness.
    • Examples show consistent high conversion and selectivity across different conditions.
    • The use of co-feeds like 141b and HCl did not negatively impact performance.
    • Regeneration of spent catalysts was successfully achieved, maintaining high activity.
    • The process was validated under various pressures and temperatures.

• The method is environmentally friendly and economically viable.
    • 143a has zero ozone depletion potential, making it a suitable refrigerant.
    • The process minimizes waste and byproduct generation.
    • It offers a practical solution for industrial-scale production.
    • The use of less toxic materials enhances safety in manufacturing.

• The invention has potential for further applications and adaptations.
    • It can be modified to utilize different feedstocks or catalysts.
    • The technology may be extrapolated to other fluorination processes.
    • Future research could explore optimizing conditions for even higher yields.
    • The method could be adapted for other halocarbon transformations.

• Overall, the invention represents a significant advancement in hydrofluorination technology.
    • It combines high efficiency with environmental considerations.
    • The process is scalable and suitable for industrial implementation.
    • The findings contribute to the ongoing development of sustainable chemical processes.

<summary>
• The invention presents an improved process for deacylation and desulfurization of pyrazolotriazoles.  
		• The process utilizes hypophosphorous acid to enhance product yield.  
		• It reduces the formation of unwanted sulfur-containing impurities.  
• Pyrazolotriazoles are valuable magenta couplers in photography but are challenging to synthesize.  
		• Current methods produce significant impurities, including elemental sulfur.  
		• These impurities can hinder subsequent reactions and affect product quality.  
• The improved process involves a two-step reaction using hypophosphorous acid.  
		• The first step is a ring contraction with acetic anhydride.  
		• The second step combines hydrolysis and desulfurization with hydrochloric acid.  
• The use of hypophosphorous acid leads to higher yields and purities in the final product.  
		• Example 1 shows an 82% yield with 98% purity using this method.  
		• Without hypophosphorous acid, yields drop to 45-50% with significant impurities.  
• The process is straightforward and economically viable for industrial adaptation.  
		• It minimizes the generation of harmful by-products like elemental sulfur.  
		• The gaseous by-product H2S is easier to manage than solid sulfur.  
• The invention allows for a variety of inert substituents in the pyrazolotriazole structure.  
		• Substituents can include hydrocarbyl groups and other functional groups.  
		• The process conditions ensure stability and non-reactivity of these substituents.  
</summary>

<summary>
* Invention Overview
    * A method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from different fiber types.
    * Sequentially takes small partial quantities from various fiber bales.
    * Aims to eliminate residual fibers and achieve a homogeneous mixture.
    * Addresses disadvantages of existing methods that leave residual fibers.

* Measurement and Removal Process
    * Each fiber bale's total quantity is measured before fiber removal.
    * A predetermined partial quantity is calculated based on the measurement.
    * Only the calculated quantity is removed from each fiber bale in sequence.
    * Ensures all fiber bales are opened without leaving residuals.

* Time Management
    * A predetermined time period is set for the removal of fiber quantities.
    * The method prevents delays that could lead to idle processing machines.
    * Coordination between the bale opener and processing machines is emphasized.
    * Aiming for consistent delivery rates to avoid wasteful idle runs.

* Apparatus Components
    * Includes a bale opener, quantity measuring device, and control device.
    * The bale opener can be various types, such as pluckers or pickers.
    * Height-measuring devices are used for accurate fiber quantity determination.
    * Control arrangements manage the operation based on measurement signals.

* Control Mechanism
    * The control device includes a computer and timing relay for operation.
    * It determines partial quantities and controls the fiber removal process.
    * Signals from limit switches and measuring devices guide the operation.
    * Ensures efficient and timely removal of fiber quantities.

* Examples of Implementation
    * Three examples illustrate the method's application in different scenarios.
    * Each example demonstrates the measurement, removal, and timing aspects.
    * Variations in removal periods for different fiber bales are discussed.
    * A table summarizes the heights and quantities for each fiber bale.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics.  
    • The yarns in at least two layers are laid at angles between 30° and 150° to the fabric's long axis.  
    • Fabrics are held together by stitching or adhesive bonding, rather than traditional knitting or weaving.  
    • Non-woven fabrics are preferred for structural applications, such as in high-speed airplanes.  
    • The invention improves upon prior art by allowing for parallel courses of yarns, enhancing strength and reducing yarn waste.  
    • A rake mechanism is introduced to ensure parallelism and control the overlap of yarn courses.  
        • The rake system can accept yarns either between needles or by impaling them.  
        • The movement of the rake is synchronized with the yarn carriers to optimize fabric formation.  
        • The final fabric is suitable for resin impregnation, providing structural integrity.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on a method and apparatus for weft insertion in multiple-color air jet looms.  
    • It aims to adjust the weft carrying force based on the thickness of the selected weft thread to optimize air consumption.  
• Traditional air jet looms use uniform air pressure for all weft threads, leading to inefficiencies.  
    • The invention proposes varying air pressure and timing to match the specific requirements of different weft threads.  
• Several embodiments are presented, showcasing different pneumatic piping systems and control mechanisms.  
    • These systems include adjustable subnozzles, pressure regulators, and control units to manage air supply effectively.  
• The invention allows for stable weft insertion and reduced air consumption, enhancing the efficiency of the weaving process.  
    • It is adaptable for looms using multiple weft threads, ensuring versatility in application.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on a process for producing bast fibre yarn with improved flexibility and reduced breakage rates.
	* The process involves health preserving bast fibres, carding, and spinning, with specific temperature and humidity conditions.
* The yarn can be made from various bast fibres, including jute, kenaf, and hemp, with specific weight percentages.
	* The process aims to achieve a lower end breakage rate, significantly improving work efficiency and product quality.
* Multiple experiments demonstrate the effectiveness of the process, showing reduced breakage rates across different fibre combinations and conditions.
	* Results indicate that the end breakage rate can be reduced to between 150-200 times per hour for yarns of 12 s fineness.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on improving nip presses used in various industries, particularly papermaking, by measuring and compensating for rotational variability in nip pressure profiles.
    • The invention utilizes multiple sensors strategically placed on a sensing roll to accurately measure pressure across different cross-directional positions.
    • It aims to provide a more accurate representation of nip pressure profiles, which is critical for achieving uniform sheet characteristics in paper production.
    • The technology allows for real-time monitoring and adjustments, enhancing productivity and reducing the risk of poor-quality output.

• The system includes methods for calculating and displaying nip pressure and rotational variability profiles using data from the sensors.
    • The sensors can be arranged in various configurations, such as helical patterns, to capture pressure readings effectively.
    • The processing unit analyzes the data to create visual displays of pressure profiles, enabling operators to make informed adjustments.
    • The invention also addresses issues related to roll wear and operational stability by monitoring pressure variations over time.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a combination electrical cord support and article holder designed for use with an ironing board.
	* It supports the electrical cord of an iron above the ironing surface and holds items like spray starch or beverages.
	* The apparatus features a removable clamp, flexible cord support, and a detachable article holder for convenience and storage.

* The design includes a "C" shaped clamp, a flexible mast for cord support, and an electrical outlet for the iron's plug.
	* The article holder is secured with tangs and can accommodate various items while preventing interference with the outlet.
	* The apparatus can be easily disassembled for storage, allowing the ironing board to be stored with the device attached.
</summary>

<summary>
* Background of the Invention
    * The invention pertains to buttonhole controlling devices for sewing machines.
    * Existing devices may not work effectively with all fabric types.
    * Variations in material can lead to improper buttonhole stitching.
    * The invention aims to ensure buttonhole stitching closes without overlap.

* Summary of the Invention
    * The device includes a foot pad and a travelling assembly.
    * The assembly moves with the fabric and includes a slidable member.
    * A tab on the slidable member actuates a tripping lever to control buttonhole length.
    * An adjustable stop allows precise definition of the closure point.

* Description of the Preferred Embodiment
    * The device attaches to a presser bar and controls a tripping lever.
    * It operates with flexible contacts to sew buttonholes in a specific mode.
    * The assembly consists of a work engaging shoe and a plate.
    * The device includes springs that define the initial position of the assembly.

* Operation of the Device
    * A button is placed between notches to set buttonhole length.
    * The presser bar is depressed to start the sewing process.
    * The machine sews top bar stitches followed by zig-zag stitches.
    * The sewing operation continues until the adjustable stop engages the lever.

* Adjustments for Different Materials
    * Operators can adjust the screw to perfect the buttonhole.
    * Adjustments are made based on the observed quality of the stitches.
    * The screw is retracted for open buttonholes and advanced for overlaps.
    * New materials require readjustment of the screw for optimal results.

* Drawings Description
    * The document includes several figures illustrating the device.
    * Figures show various views of the sewing machine and buttonhole device.
    * The drawings depict the operation and components of the device.
    * They serve as a visual aid to understand the invention's functionality.

* Conclusion
    * The invention provides a reliable solution for sewing buttonholes.
    * It accommodates various fabric types and ensures quality stitching.
    * The design allows for easy adjustments to meet different sewing needs.
    * The disclosure represents a preferred embodiment, open to modifications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for treating dyed or printed textile webs.
	* It involves applying a liquid treatment solution to a moving textile web.
	* The apparatus includes a conveyor, liquid applicator, suction device, and dwell stretch.
	* The treatment is designed to improve washing or rinsing without stacking the textile web.
* Previous methods had limitations, particularly with sensitive materials like knitted fabrics.
	* Existing techniques required a minimum textile strength, making them unsuitable for certain fabrics.
	* Stacking methods could damage printed materials or create smudges.
	* The invention aims to enhance the effectiveness of the washing process.
* The apparatus features a dwell stretch to increase the action time of the liquid on the web.
	* This allows for better removal of substances like printing thickeners.
	* The textile web remains in a spread-out, single-layer condition during treatment.
	* This configuration minimizes tension in the web, preventing damage.
* The design includes an air pass or sieve drum for the dwell stretch.
	* The air pass allows the web to be free of support elements, enhancing accessibility.
	* The sieve drum design is suitable for less resistant materials.
	* Both designs facilitate a compact construction of the apparatus.
* The suction device is strategically placed to ensure effective liquid removal.
	* It helps the textile web adhere to the conveyor belt.
	* This design prevents significant tensile stress in the web during processing.
	* The suction device operates efficiently near the return point of the web.
* The apparatus can be used for soilage washing, effectively removing dirt.
	* It allows for considerable soilage removal at low costs.
	* Fastness treatments can follow the washing operation.
	* The design is particularly advantageous for printed materials.
* The detailed description includes two embodiments of the apparatus.
	* The first embodiment uses an air pass for the dwell stretch.
	* The second embodiment employs a sieve drum for the dwell stretch.
	* Both designs maintain low tension in the textile web during treatment.
* The invention allows for various modifications and additional embodiments.
	* It encourages innovation while adhering to the core principles.
	* The description serves as a guide for understanding the invention.
	* The scope of the invention is not limited to the specific embodiments presented.
</summary>

<summary>
• Division of application Ser. No. 445,501
    • Filed on Feb. 25, 1974
    • Related to co-pending cases
    • Common assignee with the present application
    • Focus on air flow systems for dry cleaners
• Safety feature of air flow system
    • Draws ambient air into the machine when the door is opened
    • Minimizes escape of toxic solvent vapors
    • Previously used fans also circulated heat during drying
    • New system retains solvent vapors for economic reasons
• Summary of the invention
    • Provides separate air intake system
    • Reduces exhausting of residual solvent vapors
    • Intake fan and duct activated when door opens
    • Isolates solvent vapors during normal operation
• Description of the dry cleaner
    • Includes nested tubs and outer cabinet
    • Access opening aligned with tub openings
    • Contains drive motor and pump for solvent
    • Air blower circulates heated air for drying
• Solvent flow system operation
    • Stand-by condition with no solvent flow
    • Fill and wash cycle initiates solvent flow
    • Dump and spin cycle alters flow paths
    • Last minute of cycle includes backwash operation
• Air flow system operation
    • No airflow during stand-by and wash cycles
    • Valves open during drain and spin for pressure balance
    • Prevents streaks and swales during drying
    • Exhaust system activated when door is open
• Solvent vapor handling
    • Air/vapor mixture retained in expandable bag
    • Safety release valve maintains pressure limits
    • Vapor recovery during dry cycle
    • Water/solvent separation in the separator housing
• Refrigeration system operation
    • Cools storage tank to minimize vaporization
    • Continuous operation during drying cycle
    • Maintains solvent temperature within limits
    • Single compressor alternates between two evaporator coils
• Control system overview
    • Timer mechanism controls cleaning cycle
    • Door switch ensures safety during operation
    • "Cartridge dry" operation for filter maintenance
    • Manual termination of drying process after filters are dry
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention claims priority from a U.S. Provisional Patent Application and relates to methods for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments.  
	• The focus is on improvements using non-eductive drawing techniques.  
• Spun bond nonwoven production machines are categorized into eductive and non-eductive systems.  
	• Eductive systems create turbulence that can entangle filaments, while non-eductive systems have limitations in fiber spin speed.  
• The invention introduces a continuous two-dimensional slot for filament drawing, enhancing uniformity across the machine width.  
	• This design simplifies the process compared to conventional systems.  
• The system uses a quench chamber where air is accelerated uniformly to draw filaments without eduction.  
	• This reduces turbulence and allows for higher quench pressures without structural issues.  
• Filament cooling and drawing tension are controlled by regulating quench fluid temperature and flow rates.  
	• Proper exhaust flow is crucial to prevent filament sticking and breakage.  
• The apparatus is flexible, accommodating various polymers and operating conditions.  
	• It can produce fine continuous filaments for diverse applications, including nonwoven fabrics.  
• The invention addresses issues like spinning speed limitations, energy consumption, and web uniformity.  
	• It combines advantages of existing systems while minimizing their drawbacks.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The application claims priority to a Japanese patent application.
    • It relates to a sewing machine and an embroidery unit.
    • The focus is on setting sewing positions on work cloths.
    • The content is incorporated by reference.

• Current sewing machines require markers for positioning.
    • Users must affix and later remove markers.
    • This process can be cumbersome.
    • The invention aims to simplify this operation.

• The invention includes a detecting portion for ultrasonic waves.
    • It identifies the position of a transmission source.
    • The sewing machine controls sewing based on this position.
    • This eliminates the need for physical markers.

• An embroidery unit can be attached to the sewing machine.
    • It holds an embroidery frame for work cloths.
    • The unit also detects ultrasonic waves.
    • It notifies the sewing machine of detection timing.

• A non-transitory computer-readable medium stores control programs.
    • The program identifies the position of the ultrasonic wave source.
    • It controls sewing based on this identified position.
    • This enhances the sewing machine's functionality.

• The sewing machine's configuration is detailed in the first embodiment.
    • It includes various components like a bed, arm, and head.
    • Receivers detect ultrasonic waves for positioning.
    • The machine features a user interface for operation.

• The ultrasonic pen allows users to specify positions easily.
    • It transmits ultrasonic waves when pressed against the work cloth.
    • The sewing machine detects these waves for accurate positioning.
    • This method improves user experience and efficiency.

• The second embodiment involves an embroidery unit with receivers.
    • The unit is detachable from the sewing machine.
    • It allows for precise embroidery positioning.
    • The receivers are strategically placed for optimal detection.

• The third and fourth embodiments introduce wireless options.
    • The ultrasonic pen can operate without a cable.
    • Electromagnetic wave signals can replace ultrasonic signals.
    • This further enhances user convenience and flexibility.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on enhancing cellulosic fabrics with functional additives.  
    • It aims to improve properties such as UV protection, antibacterial effects, and moisture management.  
    • The invention addresses the issue of functional durability, as existing treatments often degrade after washing.  
    • The methods involve applying preparations containing wool or bamboo particles as carriers for these additives.  
• The preparation methods include pulverizing wool and bamboo into ultrafine powders.  
    • Wool particles are used to carry functional additives like zinc oxide and titanium dioxide.  
    • Bamboo powder is noted for its moisture management properties.  
    • The preparations can be applied through various methods, including printing and foam application.  
• The treated fabrics demonstrate improved durability and performance after multiple washes.  
    • The UPF (Ultraviolet Protection Factor) of treated fabrics remains significantly higher than untreated ones.  
    • Wicking performance is enhanced, allowing for better moisture absorption and quick drying.  
    • Wrinkle recovery properties are also improved due to the helical structure of wool.  
• The antibacterial properties of the treated fabrics are significantly enhanced.  
    • Tests show a high percentage of bacterial inhibition in treated fabrics compared to untreated ones.  
    • The combination of ultrafine zinc oxide and titanium dioxide contributes to these properties.  
    • The invention provides a sustainable use of wool and bamboo, utilizing materials that would otherwise be discarded.  
• The invention is adaptable and can be applied to various textile materials.  
    • It includes blended textile materials, expanding its applicability.  
    • The term "macrofibril" is used to describe wool particles that effectively carry functional additives.  
    • The invention is not limited to the described embodiments, allowing for further innovations in textile treatments.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to an automatic quilting machine designed for stitching patterns into large fabrics like bedspreads and quilts.  
    • The machine features a large metal frame that holds the fabric securely.  
    • It utilizes a sewing machine head that can stitch patterns while the fabric remains stationary.  
    • The system allows for computer-controlled movements in both X and Y directions.  
• A significant innovation is the use of two separate computers to control the sewing machine and the table movement independently.  
    • This separation simplifies the reprogramming process for either the sewing function or the table movement.  
    • Operators can modify patterns without needing to reprogram both systems, saving time and effort.  
    • The sewing machine can be programmed for various stitch patterns while the table movement can be adjusted separately.  
• The machine incorporates a computer-aided design (CAD) program for pattern creation and duplication.  
    • Operators can draw patterns on a monitor using a mouse or joystick.  
    • The drawn patterns are converted into machine-readable language for automated stitching.  
    • The system can duplicate patterns at specified locations on the fabric, enhancing production efficiency.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a method for manufacturing two-sided nonwoven fabrics.
    * The fabrics exhibit a three-dimensional image suitable for various consumer applications.
    * The process is more efficient than traditional textile methods, which involve multiple steps.
    * Nonwoven fabrics are produced directly from the carding process, enhancing economic advantages.
    * Hydroentangled fabrics improve properties like elongation and durability through composite structures.

* The method involves using precursor webs and a fluid-pervious support layer.
    * The precursor webs consist of different fibrous matrices, which can be staple fibers or continuous filaments.
    * A fiber distribution control layer is interposed to prevent excessive intermingling of the matrices.
    * Hydroentanglement is performed on a moveable imaging surface to impart a durable three-dimensional image.
    * The resulting fabric can be treated post-entanglement for enhanced performance or aesthetic properties.

* The invention addresses the need for nonwoven fabrics with pronounced images and mechanical characteristics.
    * The fabric is designed for applications in home, medical, and hygiene products.
    * It can be used in disposable absorbent hygiene articles, medical gauze, and cleaning wipes.
    * The fabric's structure allows for softness and exfoliating properties, making it suitable for intimate contact with skin.
    * The incorporation of a support layer improves overall performance and resistance to delamination.

* The manufacturing process includes pre-entangling the precursor webs before imaging.
    * This step integrates the fibrous components without imparting a three-dimensional image.
    * The imaging process utilizes a three-dimensional image transfer device to create distinct surface properties.
    * The support layer can be made from various materials, including spunbond and nanofiber fabrics.
    * The method allows for customization of the fabric's properties based on the intended end-use.

* The fabric can include apertures for added functionality.
    * Apertures can vary in shape and size, enhancing the fabric's versatility.
    * They may extend through one or more layers of the fabric.
    * The design of the apertures can be uniform or randomly distributed.
    * This feature can be beneficial for specific applications, such as wipes or absorbent products.

* The invention allows for numerous modifications and applications.
    * The nonwoven fabric can be used in protective wear, vehicle covers, and apparel construction.
    * It is suitable for both medical and industrial uses, enhancing its market potential.
    * The fabric's durability and aesthetic appeal make it ideal for a wide range of consumer products.

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a device for feeding material into sewing machines.
	* It aims to improve the sewing process for stiff strips of material like cardboard and leather.
* Existing devices rely on the needle as a stop, which can deform with stiff materials.
	* This deformation can lead to erroneous stitches and damage to the sewing machine.
* The new device allows for continuous operation without manual intervention.
	* It uses a stop that can be moved into and out of the feed path of the strip.
* The control means includes a signal transmitter that activates sewing machine functions.
	* This allows for the strip to be positioned correctly before sewing begins.
* The device features a two-armed lever biased by a spring for stop movement.
	* The stop can be adjusted using an air cylinder for precise positioning.
* A proximity switch is used to control the sewing machine's operation based on the strip's position.
	* This ensures that the sewing process is initiated only when the strip is correctly aligned.
* The design is intended to be simple, rugged, and economical for manufacturing.
	* It enhances the efficiency and reliability of sewing operations involving strip materials.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a knitting method and knit fabric for various clothing items.
	* * It specifically addresses the joining of tape- or rope-shaped knit fabrics in collars, tank tops, and stockings.
* Traditional methods involve separate sewing processes that reduce productivity.
	* * These methods can lead to irregularities and increased manufacturing costs.
* The invention aims to connect two tape-shaped knit pieces during the knitting process.
	* * This is achieved using a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds.
* The method involves overlaying loops from two knit pieces to create a seamless connection.
	* * This process is repeated until the pieces are securely joined.
* The knitting machine used has multiple needles and can move in a lateral direction.
	* * This allows for precise control over the knitting and joining process.
* The knitting diagrams illustrate the steps involved in joining the knit fabrics.
	* * These diagrams show the movement of needle beds and the transfer of loops.
* The final product has a neat appearance and improved comfort compared to traditional methods.
	* * The method prevents thickened junctions that can affect wearability.
* The invention can be applied to various knit fabric types, including plain and rib knitting.
	* * It is versatile enough for use in different clothing items beyond sweaters.
* The knitting process is computer-controlled for accuracy and efficiency.
	* * This ensures that the knitting pattern is followed precisely during production.
* Overall, the invention enhances the knitting process by integrating joining techniques directly into the knitting phase.
	* * This innovation leads to reduced labor costs and improved product quality.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on a flexible traction element for lifts.
	* It consists of stranded cables made from tensile strength materials.
	* A production line is designed for embedding these cables in thermoplastic materials.
	* The method enhances flexibility and adhesion between cables and jackets.
	* The traction element can be wound and unwound easily.

* The production line includes various components for processing stranded cables.
	* It features reels, heaters, extruders, and cooling troughs.
	* The extruder has a thread guide and adjustable matrix for precise cable positioning.
	* Pressure rollers help maintain the shape and surface structure of the traction element.
	* The process allows for high-speed production and quality control.

* The method for embedding stranded cables involves several steps.
	* Cables are degreased and preheated before coating.
	* The liquefied thermoplastic material is applied during extrusion.
	* Tensioning of cables is controlled for optimal adhesion.
	* The method improves long-term performance and flexibility.

* The traction elements have diverse applications, especially in lifting.
	* They meet high safety standards for lift operations.
	* The design allows for effective deflection and storage.
	* They can also function as electric conductors with appropriate materials.
	* The tensile strength of the cables is significant, ensuring reliability.

* The detailed description includes various embodiments and configurations.
	* Drawings illustrate the production line and traction element designs.
	* Different cross-sectional shapes and surface structures are explored.
	* Adjustments in the production process enhance precision and quality.
	* Variants of the design cater to specific operational needs.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a rotary hook arrangement for lockstitch sewing machines.
	* * It aims to minimize hindrance during the guiding and pull-back of the needle thread loop.
	* * The design includes a spring rod and strategically placed cams to facilitate smooth thread movement.

* Previous rotary hook designs faced issues with thread tension and movement impediments.
	* * Existing solutions either restricted thread movement or increased needle thread tension.
	* * The invention addresses these issues by relocating holding means to reduce interference.

* The rotary hook features a capsule release device that provides a rotational impulse to the bobbin housing.
	* * This impulse creates a temporary gap for the needle thread loop to pass through unhindered.
	* * The design allows for a jerk-free motion of the needle thread loop during operation.

* The invention is characterized by its simplicity, ruggedness, and cost-effectiveness.
	* * It offers improved sewing properties compared to conventional rotary hooks.
	* * The low mass of the spring rod ensures minimal resistance during thread movement.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on methods for producing silicon-based nanostructures.
    * It utilizes four-component and five-component inks comprising liquid silanes, polymers, accelerants, and solvents.
    * The electrospinning technique allows for continuous manufacturing of nanofibers and films.
    * Applications include use in batteries, sensors, and electronic devices.
    * The process aims to overcome limitations of traditional silicon production methods.

* The electrospinning process is detailed with specific formulations and conditions.
    * Preferred liquid silanes include cyclohexasilane and cyclopentasilane.
    * The inks can incorporate solid phases such as metals or semiconductors.
    * Transformation of the deposited fibers occurs through thermal treatment or light activation.
    * The resulting materials exhibit improved mechanical stability and conductivity.

* The invention claims various advantages over existing methods.
    * It enables scalable production without the need for high temperatures or localized catalysts.
    * The resulting silicon nanowires can accommodate volume changes during battery cycling.
    * The methods allow for the introduction of additional components to tailor material properties.
    * The invention is positioned to enhance the performance of lithium-ion batteries and other applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to thread tension control in spool creels.
	* It features adjustable braking elements influenced by thread tension and weight.
* Current market solutions allow for automatic reduction of braking force as spool diameter decreases.
	* However, they often lack individual control over each spool's tension.
* The invention provides a system where thread tension can be adjusted for individual spools and the entire array.
	* This is achieved through fluid pressure-controlled biasing arrangements for each spool holder.
* The tensioning lever's position is influenced by thread tension and is designed to allow for quick braking when needed.
	* A piston/cylinder assembly is used for biasing, ensuring no contamination of threads.
* The design includes specific angles for the tensioning lever and biasing arrangement to maintain consistent force application.
	* The biasing arrangement can also engage a brake shoe for rapid braking during machine shutdown.
* An alternative embodiment utilizes an electromagnetic brake system for tension control.
	* This system generates eddy currents in a braking disc to adjust braking force based on the lever's position.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention introduces a sewing machine detector that improves upon conventional designs.
    • The detector is integrated with the sewing machine's drive and control elements.
    • It aims to provide a more compact and durable design that minimizes stress on optical fibers.
    • The detector can accurately detect the position of the sewing needle and the speed of the machine.
    • It includes a power indicating light that does not interfere with the control circuitry.

• The preferred embodiment features a new design with light shielding discs and optical fiber supporters.
    • The light shielding discs are made from light-transmitting synthetic resin and are mounted coaxially.
    • The optical fiber supporter ensures that the optical fibers are not flexed, reducing stress.
    • Light is transmitted through the discs to detect various signals, including needle positions and speed.
    • The design allows for easy angle adjustments and accurate optical alignment.

• The invention addresses issues found in conventional detectors, such as vibration and signal interference.
    • It eliminates the need for curved reflective discs, making manufacturing simpler and cheaper.
    • The stationary reflecting portions enhance stability and reduce wear-related issues.
    • The optical fiber power indicating cable runs alongside detection fibers, simplifying construction.
    • Overall, the invention provides a reliable and efficient solution for sewing machine control.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention presents a simplified process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
	* The process includes critical operations such as completion of coagulation, washing with non-alkaline pH water, and drying, resulting in a finished yarn with a degree of white not lower than 45.
* The process aims to improve efficiency by reducing the number of treatments and space required for spinning machines while maintaining or enhancing the quality of the yarn.
	* Key parameters include specific coagulation indices and washing conditions, with preferred temperatures and treatment durations to achieve optimal results.
* Comparative analysis shows that the proposed method yields significantly higher degrees of whiteness and lower levels of impurities compared to traditional processes.
	* The invention demonstrates that using water treated with weakly acid ion exchange resins leads to superior yarn quality and reduced economic burden.
</summary>

<summary>
* Related Cases
    * Continuation-in-part of patent application Ser. No. 594,455.
    * Original application filed on Mar. 29, 1984.
    * The previous application is now abandoned.
    * Focuses on improvements in pulp bleaching processes.
    
* Background of the Invention
    * Problem with oxygen bleaching: foam formation during washing.
    * Existing solutions include the "Deculator" process and various patents.
    * Current systems are expensive and require large equipment.
    * Need for a smaller, efficient deaeration tank identified.

* Summary of the Invention
    * Development of a small deaeration tank for pulp treatment.
    * Designed to operate at atmospheric or low pressure.
    * No moving parts, reducing maintenance needs.
    * Can recover steam or oxygen during operation.

* Description of the Preferred Embodiment
    * Overall oxygen process illustrated in diagrams.
    * Pulp is treated with steam and oxygen before deaeration.
    * Deaeration tank features an inlet and outlet for pulp flow.
    * Filtrate from the washer is used to induce swirl in the tank.

* Deaeration Tank Specifications
    * Tank dimensions are based on the diameter of the oxygen reactor.
    * Inlet and outlet pipes are strategically placed for optimal flow.
    * Tank can be closed for pressure or vacuum operation.
    * Specific dimensions provided for a 50-ton pulp per day installation.

* Operational Details
    * Filtrate enters the tank at controlled velocities.
    * Emergency bypass line included for system stability.
    * Height sensors maintain consistent pulp levels in the tank.
    * Various components designed for efficient pulp processing.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention introduces biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials that enhance structural performance, particularly in out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.  
    • The design process utilizes function-oriented material design (FOMD) and topology optimization to create materials tailored for specific structural functions and loading conditions.  
• BTR composites consist of stuffer members and tendon elements arranged in various configurations, including flat and curved panels, to achieve optimal structural integrity.  
    • These materials can incorporate a range of fibers and matrix materials, allowing for innovative applications in lightweight and high-performance structures.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a load-limiting device designed to dissipate energy during dynamic events, such as earthquakes.
    • The device can undergo plastic deformation to limit loads on structures, making it easier to repair or replace after damage.
    • It is intended for use in braced frame structures, providing biaxial support and energy dissipation.
    • The device can be easily removed and replaced after a dynamic event.

• The prior art highlights the challenges faced by buildings during seismic events, including inelastic behavior and extensive damage.
    • Traditional systems, like moment-resistant frames, may suffer severe damage and require costly repairs or demolition.
    • Hydraulic dampers have been used but come with maintenance challenges and high costs for older structures.
    • The invention aims to improve upon these systems by providing a more effective and maintainable solution.

• The load-limiting device can be constructed from various materials and shapes to suit different structural applications.
    • It may include features like connection points for easy attachment to existing structures.
    • The device's design allows for energy dissipation during multiple load cycles without premature failure.
    • An indicator means may be incorporated to detect plastic deformation, aiding in post-event inspections.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces a box-shaped bedroom cabinet designed for flophouse facilities, optimizing space for individual sleeping areas without protruding elements.
	* The cabinet features dual construction for enhanced strength, flat external surfaces for stacking, and integrated storage for devices like interphones and TVs without reducing living space.
* The cabinet's design includes a clearance between outer and inner casings for ventilation and sound-proofing, with various spacer members to support structural integrity.
	* This design allows for efficient air flow and accommodates electrical wiring while maintaining a compact and functional living environment.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to a portable guard rail support system.  
    • It is designed for temporary safety barriers at construction sites.  
    • Aimed at enhancing worker safety during construction activities.  
 
• Safety barriers are essential in modern construction practices.  
    • They prevent accidental falls from uncompleted floors.  
    • They also protect against the dislodgement of materials.  

• Traditional methods of constructing guard rails are inefficient.  
    • They often require multiple workers and significant time.  
    • Materials used can be damaged and not always reusable.  

• There is a need for a simple and portable guard rail system.  
    • The system should meet safety guidelines effectively.  
    • It should allow for quick assembly and disassembly.  

• The guard rail support includes several key components.  
    • It features a flat base plate and an upright column.  
    • It has brackets for guard rails and a retaining flange for kick boards.  

• A concrete-filled steel base is an alternative anchoring method.  
    • This base allows for stability when ground anchoring is not possible.  
    • It includes a groove for the guard rail support to slide into.  

• The guard rail assembly can be configured in various ways.  
    • It can use overlapping wooden rails or short stubs for support.  
    • The design accommodates different lumber sizes as needed.  

• The system includes safety tie-off rings for fall protection.  
    • These rings can support safety cables for workers.  
    • They can also secure weatherproof tarpaulins for protection.  

• The guard rail supports are designed for easy installation and removal.  
    • A single worker can install the system without assistance.  
    • The design minimizes damage to materials during disassembly.  

• The invention can be adapted for various construction scenarios.  
    • It is suitable for roofs, bridges, and other drop-off edges.  
    • The system provides a high return on investment due to durability.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on enhancing crude oil recovery from reservoirs using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods.
	* The method aims to overcome limitations of existing techniques by generating high-frequency acoustic vibrations and electromagnetic pulses that stimulate oil flow over greater distances than traditional methods.
* Various embodiments of the invention include multi-level discharge devices and customizable pulse sources to optimize stimulation based on reservoir characteristics.
	* These innovations allow for improved separation of recovered hydrocarbons and the potential for increased production efficiency in oil fields.
</summary>

<summary>
* The application is a continuation-in-part of a previous patent related to soil reinforcing connectors.
	* It discusses Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures used for various applications like retaining walls and dams.
	* The technology involves layering backfill and soil reinforcing elements to create stable earthen structures.
	* A need for a system to splice soil reinforcing elements to extend their length is identified.

* The disclosure introduces a splice for soil reinforcing elements.
	* The splice includes wave plates with protrusions to seat transverse wires from both the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip.
	* Connective devices are used to secure the splice and prevent removal of the wires.
	* The splice allows for the creation of composite soil reinforcing elements to achieve desired lengths.

* Various embodiments and configurations of the splice are described.
	* The transverse wires can be arranged in different spacing patterns along the longitudinal wires.
	* Multiple splices and grid-strips can be used to extend the length of a soil reinforcing element as needed.
	* The design allows for flexibility in reinforcing vertical facings in MSE applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a novel plow blade design that incorporates fluid passageways for improved utility line installation.
    * The blade allows for efficient manufacturing and maintenance, reducing costs.
    * Fluid is ejected at controlled locations to minimize drag and enhance cutting efficiency.
    * Various configurations can be tailored for specific soil conditions and installation depths.
    * The design includes components that can be replaced or rebuilt as needed.

* Multiple embodiments of the plow blade are presented, showcasing different fluid routing methods.
    * A fluid tube can be positioned in various locations to optimize fluid pressure and flow.
    * Manifolds and nozzles can be used to control fluid injection rates and locations.
    * The assembly process allows for easy modifications without extensive welding.
    * Each embodiment maintains the ability to adapt to specific job requirements while using traditional manufacturing techniques.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a building system for stucco type cavity wall construction.
    • It allows for larger panels exceeding 2.4 meters in height and 4 meters in width.
    • The system can function with or without movement control joints.
    • It aims to provide compliance with New Zealand building codes NZS3604 and NZS4251.
    • The panels can be created in situ with a nominal thickness of 21 mm.
    • The system includes a frame, battens, and multiple layers of plaster matrix.
    • Reinforcement is achieved through inner and outer meshes, with additional regional reinforcement.
    • The construction method involves applying plaster in multiple layers, embedding the mesh for structural integrity.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a new and improved safe structure designed for containing valuable items.
	* It features a valuables receiving chamber with a rectangular opening and a unique door engagement mechanism.
	* The door is secured with a lock assembly that prevents lateral movement and enhances security against forced entry.
	* The safe can be constructed using various materials, including plastic and metal, and can be embedded in concrete or used as a free-standing unit.

* The design incorporates safety features to protect the locking mechanism from damage during attempted break-ins.
	* Safety bolts are positioned near the lock to absorb lateral forces and prevent damage to the lockset.
	* The door can be easily inserted and removed, allowing for straightforward operation while maintaining security.
	* Variations in construction methods and materials are possible, providing flexibility in design and application.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on improved techniques for measuring fluid pressures in geological formations.
    • The goal is to accurately measure pressure at specific depths without interference from surrounding pressures.
    • Applications include civil engineering, hydro-geology, and petroleum engineering.
    • Traditional methods like standpipe piezometers have limitations due to their volume and connection issues.

• New methods involve using pressure transducers and cement grouting techniques.
    • A conduit with a filter is cemented in place, allowing for direct pressure measurement from the formation.
    • Fluid is injected to clear cement from the filter and establish a connection to the formation.
    • The system can include features like check valves and packers for better pressure management.

• The invention addresses the need for isolation of pressure sensors in boreholes.
    • This isolation prevents measurement interference from pressures above or below the sensor.
    • The method allows for multiple sensors to be installed in a single operation.
    • It enhances the accuracy of pressure readings in low permeability formations.

• Various embodiments of the invention are described for different applications.
    • These include configurations for groundwater monitoring and petroleum reservoir assessments.
    • Each embodiment utilizes specific components like filters, valves, and transducers.
    • The designs allow for flexibility in sensor placement and maintenance.

• The installation process involves several stages to ensure proper function.
    • Initial fluid injection clears the filter and establishes a connection to the formation.
    • Cement grouting is performed to secure the conduit and isolate the sensor.
    • Additional fluid injections may be used to enhance connectivity and pressure measurement.

• The invention provides a reliable system for monitoring geological formation pressures.
    • It allows for accurate readings that reflect the true formation pressures at desired depths.
    • The system is adaptable to various geological conditions and monitoring needs.
    • It represents a significant advancement over traditional pressure measurement techniques.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a jointing structure for vehicle traveling paths with an expansion function.
	* * It is particularly useful for new transit systems, monorails, and road bridges.
* Existing rubber and steel expansion joints face issues with slip resistance and durability.
	* * These problems can lead to tire fall-in or stuck-in situations, especially in extreme temperature changes.
* The proposed jointing structure includes multiple steps and elastic members to absorb expansion and contraction.
	* * A joint block is positioned across the expansion gap to enhance safety and riding quality.
* The elastic members are designed to be hard to deform vertically but easy to deform horizontally.
	* * Laminated rubber is primarily used for these elastic members, allowing for effective maintenance.
* The structure allows for the management of vertical and lateral displacements due to environmental factors.
	* * This design minimizes the need for emergency measures after events like earthquakes.
* The method of mounting the elastic members is adaptable to seasonal changes and temperature variations.
	* * This ensures that the expansion gap remains functional without requiring frequent adjustments.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to floor track systems for transporting food products in sanitary environments.
	* * Traditional air chilling methods lead to dehydration of meat products.
	* * Fluid treatment chambers using chilled brine solutions are more effective but require sanitary transport systems.
* Overhead rail systems have limitations, including fixed routes and contamination risks.
	* * Contaminated brine solutions cannot be reused without sterilization.
	* * Wheeled dolly-like trucks offer mobility but risk contamination from the plant floor.
* The invention aims to create a floor transport system that prevents contamination of treatment fluids.
	* * The system allows for the use of wheeled trucks while maintaining sanitary conditions.
	* * It segregates the wheels from the treatment solution to ensure fluid cleanliness.
* Two embodiments of the enclosed floor track system are described.
	* * One uses a wheel channel with a cover plate to prevent fluid entry.
	* * The other employs inflatable seals to enclose the wheel structure.
* The enclosed track system enhances the recovery and reuse of brine solutions.
	* * It preserves natural resources and provides economic advantages.
	* * The design prevents brine from contacting the hand truck wheels, avoiding contamination.
* The invention is adaptable for various transport vehicles beyond hand trucks.
	* * It can be applied in different industries requiring sanitary transport solutions.
	* * The system's construction is designed to resist corrosion from brine solutions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a lock device for construction machines, specifically to prevent the downward rotation of a backhoe boom due to its weight.
	* The device includes an engaging member and an engaged member that allows for easy manual lock operation.
* Conventional locking mechanisms have issues with friction and wear, leading to reduced lifespan of components.
	* The proposed design minimizes contact and friction between moving parts, enhancing durability.
* The lock device features a support pin and guide member that stabilize the engaging member during operation.
