	* This design allows the lock to maintain its position regardless of the boom's angle, simplifying the mechanism and reducing costs.
* The invention is applicable to various machinery, including excavators, loaders, and cranes, ensuring safety during operation and transport.
	* It provides a reliable solution to prevent unintended movement of heavy machinery components.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to swimming pool vacuum cleaning devices.  
	• It features a flexible platform with an adjustable vacuum portion for regulating suction efficiency.  
• Prior art devices typically require manual adjustment of suction heads.  
	• This process is cumbersome and not efficient for commercial pool cleaning operators.  
• The invention allows for real-time suction adjustment directly on the vacuum head.  
	• Adjustment mechanisms are conveniently located on the top of the suction head.  
• The design includes a central suction portion and outboard roller assemblies.  
	• The outboard rollers can be adjusted using wing nuts for height regulation.  
• A unique frame member spans the platform, facilitating the adjustment of inboard rollers.  
	• The frame members are designed to accommodate existing roller constructions with minimal modifications.  
• The invention can be retrofitted to existing devices with a simple kit.  
	• The kit includes frames, connectors, wing nuts, springs, and axles for easy assembly.  
• The adjustment mechanism is designed to be user-friendly and cost-effective.  
	• It allows precise regulation of suction without needing to adjust the pool's circulation pump.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to oil well drilling tools, specifically an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from well heads and casings.
	* It addresses the limitations of existing methods that require the drill bit for retrieval, allowing for retrieval without removing the bit.
* The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel and a retriever section that can slide vertically but not rotate, preventing damage during retrieval.
	* This design allows for vertical play, reducing the risk of crimping the wear bushing due to the weight of the drill string.
* The retriever section is equipped with protruding members that engage with a J-slot in the wear bushing for secure retrieval.
	* An alternative embodiment features a threaded retriever section for engaging threaded wear bushings.
* The invention aims to provide a simple, efficient, and cost-effective solution for wear bushing retrieval during drilling operations.
	* It allows for quick installation and removal, enhancing operational efficiency in oil and gas drilling.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to downhole vibratory tools that allow for the passage of other tools through them.  
	• The design addresses limitations of previous tools by providing a central passageway for wireline access.  
• Traditional vibratory tools faced issues such as rapid wear of components and limited power delivery.  
	• The new design features an annular dump valve that avoids slamming against a seat, enhancing reliability.  
• The tool utilizes stacked pistons to increase power delivery and improve operational efficiency.  
	• This modular design allows for customization based on specific downhole conditions and requirements.  
• The tool can operate with or without impacts, providing versatility for various applications, including fishing and stimulation operations.  
	• It features a simple plug mechanism for activation, reducing complexity and cost.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention introduces a precast concrete retaining wall system designed for taller walls and shorter bases.
    • The system consists of a precast face panel with an integral counterfort and a precast base, allowing for quick assembly on-site.
    • It eliminates the need for temporary shoring during installation and can withstand wind loads immediately after assembly.
    • Custom sizes for components can be easily produced, enhancing flexibility in design and application.
    • The connection between the face panel and base is secured using rebar and grout, ensuring stability and strength.

• The invention addresses limitations of prior art retaining walls, particularly regarding height and installation challenges.
    • Traditional methods often require extensive excavation and temporary supports, limiting wall height to 10-12 feet.
    • The new design allows for greater wall heights without the need for labor-intensive onsite forming or curing.
    • Additional features, such as drainage openings and shear keys, improve performance and stability.
    • The system can incorporate vehicle impact barriers, enhancing safety without complicating the installation process.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on improving down hole heating systems for oil and gas wells.  
    • The system aims to enhance production by addressing issues related to oil viscosity and paraffin blockage.  
    • It emphasizes the need for effective heat concentration in the production zone to facilitate flow.  
    • The design aims to prevent failures caused by chemical and physical attacks on electrical components.  
• The heating unit incorporates advanced protective measures for electrical connections.  
    • It features a cement block encasement to shield connections from hostile well conditions.  
    • Solid copper leads with KAPTON insulation are used to ensure reliable power delivery.  
    • The design allows for modifications and alternative methods of installation, including wire line applications.  
• Field applications have shown significant improvements in oil well flow rates compared to existing systems.  
    • The invention addresses long-standing issues that have led to costly repairs and production losses.  
    • It provides a more reliable and effective solution for down hole heating challenges.  
    • The approach is adaptable for various well conditions, including deep gas wells with specific occlusion problems.  
</summary>

<summary>
* Invention Overview
	* * Relates to down hole tools for mechanical activities in wells.
	* * Focuses on mechanisms for installing and removing objects, including stuck items.

* Background Context
	* * Addresses issues with lost or stuck objects, known as "fish," in well bores.
	* * Highlights problems with existing pull tools, particularly in disconnection from worn fishing necks.

* Common Challenges
	* * Pulling tools may become stuck, complicating retrieval and increasing service costs.
	* * Mechanical shocks can damage components, necessitating a more reliable disconnection method.

* Invention Summary
	* * Introduces an external pull tool or overshot for well servicing operations.
	* * Features a telescoping design for establishing and releasing connections with down hole objects.

* Tool Mechanism
	* * Comprises an outer tubular body and an inner body structure with a catch mechanism.
	* * Allows for simple locking and unlocking through controlled movement of the tool.

* Preferred Embodiment
	* * Describes a specific design with adjustable components for accurate positioning.
	* * Incorporates a locking mechanism with guide pins and spring elements for reliable operation.

* Alternative Embodiments
	* * Discusses variations of the tool, including an overshot structure for grappling.
	* * Emphasizes the ability to adapt the tool for different service operations.

* Operational Flexibility
	* * Allows for repeated latching and unlatching without removing the tool from the well.
	* * Facilitates easy replacement with heavier-duty tools if necessary.

* Conclusion
	* * Aims to improve efficiency in down hole service operations and fishing activities.
	* * Encourages exploration of various embodiments within the invention's scope.
</summary>

<summary>
• The application relates to improvements in composed stave floors.
	• The method involves using a sight substrate of at least 4 mm and a base substrate of at least 12 mm.
	• Multidirectional holding means, including dendrites and clamps, are used to enhance adhesion and prevent deformation.

• Current stave floors face issues such as detachment and deformation due to thin substrates and inadequate bonding methods.
	• Conventional floors typically have a sight substrate thickness of 2-3 mm, leading to poor durability.
	• The proposed method aims to extend the lifespan and allow for corrective maintenance of the floors.

• The example embodiment demonstrates a successful assembly of substrates resulting in a durable floor.
	• A test showed that the new design did not exhibit deformation or detachment after use.
	• Corrective maintenance was possible, restoring the floor's original properties.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to ladder attachments designed to enhance stability and protect work surfaces.
	* * It addresses issues of ladder instability and potential damage to surfaces during use.
	* * The invention allows ladders to straddle corners without compromising stability.

* The ladder attachment features a brace with a resilient pad assembly for improved contact area.
	* * The brace is secured using a U-bolt and can be adjusted for different ladder sizes.
	* * The resilient pad assembly pivots to adapt to various work surfaces.

* The design aims to prevent slipping and sliding while maintaining a broad contact area.
	* * This non-slip feature ensures that the ladder grips the work surface without causing damage.
	* * The increased contact area enhances lateral stability during use.

* The invention allows for modifications and adaptations to suit different ladder types and materials.
	* * Various configurations can be implemented to improve performance on less sturdy ladders.
	* * The design is flexible, accommodating changes without deviating from the core invention principles.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a collated fastener assembly designed to minimize debris during use in fastener driving tools.
    • The assembly features a plastic collation system that adheres to the fasteners, ensuring that the plastic remains attached during driving.
    • The collation is formed from an adhesive polymer, which enhances the rigidity of the nail strip and reduces the likelihood of corrugation.
    • A method for manufacturing the assembly includes preheating the fasteners before molding the plastic, which significantly improves adhesion.
    • The design includes preferentially weakened regions to encourage separation at desired locations, further reducing debris generation.

• The fastener assembly is applicable in various construction industries and can be configured for both straight and coiled applications.
    • The nails are arranged in a staggered manner, allowing for effective driving into substrates like wood.
    • The assembly can include features such as tapered collars and ribs to enhance penetration and holding power.
    • Testing has shown that the assembly generates significantly less debris compared to traditional collated nails.
    • The invention aims to improve the efficiency and cleanliness of fastening operations in construction settings.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to a nozzle for applying sealants in various industries.
	• The nozzle features a bell or hood lower section and an injection button.
	• It is designed for use in aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics industries.

• Current nozzles have limitations in precision and compatibility with different sealant application methods.
	• Existing metal nozzles are reusable but require hazardous cleaning solvents.
	• They lack the ability to apply sealants accurately in tight spaces, such as around rivets and screws.

• The nozzle aims to improve sealant application efficiency and accuracy.
	• It allows for both manual and automated application methods.
	• The design facilitates encapsulation of rivets and nuts, enhancing sealing effectiveness.

• The nozzle consists of a main elongated body, a connecting section, and a bell-shaped section.
	• The connecting section features a threaded exterior for compatibility with various cartridges.
	• The bell-shaped section is designed to cover rivets and nuts completely.

• Two embodiments of the nozzle are described, each with unique injection button designs.
	• The first embodiment has a button with radially oriented channels for precise sealant flow.
	• The second embodiment includes lateral openings for directing sealant around screws.

• The nozzle simplifies sealing operations, reducing application time and improving quality.
	• It can be adapted for traditional truncated-cone applications after initial use.
	• The design enhances the aesthetic and functional aspects of sealant application.
</summary>

<summary>
* The application claims benefits from two U.S. Provisional Applications.
    * Both applications relate to position sensors.
    * Filed on November 25, 2003.
    * Disclosures are incorporated by reference.

* The invention focuses on position and motion sensors.
    * Aims to monitor moving parts in mechanical systems.
    * Example includes diesel engine fuel injectors.
    * Addresses challenges with biodiesel fuel characteristics.

* Mechanical systems often require multiple sensors for monitoring.
    * Each injector in an engine needs a separate sensor.
    * Wiring must withstand extreme conditions.
    * Reducing wiring complexity is essential for efficiency.

* Current output signals can minimize wiring needs.
    * Sensors can operate with just two wires.
    * Current drawn is proportional to the monitored object's position.
    * Example: 0 mA at rest, 5 mA at closest position.

* Multiplexing can further reduce wiring requirements.
    * All sensors can connect to the same wires.
    * Timing signals help identify which sensor is active.
    * This method is efficient for internal combustion engines.

* Position sensors generate signals proportional to distance.
    * Noise can interfere with the desired signal.
    * Noise is categorized as low or high frequency.
    * High-frequency noise can be filtered out easily.

* Low-frequency noise presents challenges for two-wire sensors.
    * Static DC offsets can affect sensor reliability.
    * Increased current can lead to power dissipation issues.
    * Sensors should minimize current draw during power-up.

* The invention includes a signal conditioning method.
    * A waveform generator modifies sensing signals.
    * An error correction generator removes unwanted signals.
    * The system aims to maintain a minimum energy requirement.

* A window reference circuit adjusts sensor outputs.
    * Compares conditioned outputs to preset reference signals.
    * Ensures outputs remain within desired limits.
    * Allows for rapid recalibration during sudden changes.

* The sensor design allows for efficient operation and calibration.
    * Uses a counter and DAC for error correction.
    * Maintains signal integrity during object movement.
    * Supports a two-wire connection for easy integration.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines.
	* * It aims to improve valve control for better engine performance and fuel efficiency.
* Traditional valve systems use springs to close valves, which limits engine speed and efficiency.
	* * The proposed system eliminates springs, allowing for higher engine speeds and reduced energy loss.
* The valve actuation system allows for infinitely variable control of valve openings.
	* * This enables precise adjustments based on engine performance and operational conditions.
* The system can operate any number of cylinders independently or in unison.
	* * This flexibility enhances fuel economy by allowing the engine to run on fewer cylinders when needed.
* The design includes a rotary cam and a translating mechanism for valve movement.
	* * The mechanism ensures smooth and timely opening and closing of valves.
* Computer control is integrated for real-time adjustments to valve positions.
	* * This allows for optimal performance during various driving conditions.
* The invention is applicable to engines with multiple valves per cylinder.
	* * It can be adapted for configurations with four or six valves, enhancing versatility.
* Overall, the system simplifies valve actuation while improving efficiency and performance.
	* * It offers a robust solution compared to traditional cam-spring systems in automotive engines.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to aquarium lighting, specifically using LEDs.  
		• It addresses the need for improved lighting solutions in residential aquariums.  
		• The design aims to enhance the health and well-being of aquatic organisms.  
		
• The light member features a housing with a top side and a bottom side.  
		• The bottom side faces the aquarium interior, providing illumination.  
		• It includes a lighting control region with multiple control channels for different light colors.  
		
• Two control channels allow independent control of white and blue light.  
		• The white light channel serves as a daylight option, while the blue light channel is for night mode.  
		• Users can adjust the color temperature output between 3500K to 15,000K.  
		
• Light-emitting modules can be added or removed from the lighting control region.  
		• Each module is designed to emit either white or blue light.  
		• The modules are secured using a tab mechanism for easy installation.  
		
• The design allows for various configurations and functionalities.  
		• Users can customize the number and type of light-emitting modules.  
		• Options for remote control and in-line timers are also available.  
		
• The light members can be adapted for use beyond aquariums, such as under cabinets.  
		• They can be linked in series for broader lighting applications.  
		• The design includes features for easy installation and control accessibility.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for thermal machines, particularly gas turbines.
	* It addresses the limitations of existing stator and rotor blades that experience high temperatures.
	* The invention aims to improve cooling efficiency and production simplicity.

* Current gas turbine blades utilize cast cooling channels and separating walls, which have several disadvantages.
	* These include increased weight, thermal stresses, and complex manufacturing processes.
	* The transitional regions between hot-gas walls and separating walls are difficult to cool effectively.

* The proposed solution involves using separate inserts for the separating walls instead of casting them.
	* This design reduces material in critical areas, minimizing thermal stresses and weight.
	* Inserts can be easily adjusted or replaced to optimize cooling performance.

* Preferred embodiments include blades with integrated holders for the inserts and options for securing them.
	* The inserts can be straight or U-shaped, allowing for flexible cooling channel configurations.
	* The design simplifies assembly and enhances the overall cooling system's adaptability.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a system for controlling fuel delivery in vehicles, allowing for both automatic and manual operation.
	• The system includes a control unit that processes signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve to optimize performance.
	• It ensures smooth transitions between control modes to prevent vehicle lurching or stalling.

• The system addresses deficiencies in prior art, such as limited throttle control during malfunctions.
	• It allows full vehicle operation under manual control, unlike previous systems that restricted speed.
	• The control unit can detect faults and switch to manual mode automatically or at the driver's command.

• The invention can be integrated with continuously variable transmissions for optimal throttle control based on transmission ratios.
	• At high ratios, manual control is preferred, while automatic control is favored at low ratios.
	• Various subroutines and logic sequencers are employed to manage the operation of stepper or DC motors for throttle control.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention introduces a waste fuel burner designed to efficiently combust wood waste and reduce particulate emissions.  
		• The burner operates with minimal particulate discharge, adhering to environmental regulations.  
		• It can effectively burn wet wood with high moisture content and produces little slag or clinkers.  
		
• The burner features a dual combustion chamber system that utilizes controlled air flow for gasification and combustion.  
		• Preheated underfire air is introduced to dry and gasify the waste fuel, while swirl air enhances particulate separation.  
		• Secondary combustion air is added for complete combustion, allowing for high temperatures and efficient heat generation.  
		
• The control system adjusts air and fuel flow based on BTU demand, ensuring quick response times and efficient operation.  
		• The system includes sensors to monitor temperatures and oxygen levels, optimizing combustion conditions.  
		• It allows for manual or automatic overrides, providing flexibility in operation.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to an efficient evaporative refrigeration system for air conditioning.
	* * It utilizes a heat exchanger to separate wet and dry air, preventing moisture addition to the cooled air.
	* * The system recirculates working air from the enclosure to maximize cooling efficiency.

* The design incorporates various operational features to enhance cooling performance.
	* * Fresh air is primarily used for the dry side, while return air is used for the wet side to achieve a larger temperature differential.
	* * Additional cooling can be achieved by integrating a vapor compression refrigeration unit for dehumidification.

* The apparatus is designed for energy efficiency compared to traditional vapor compression systems.
	* * It operates with significantly lower power consumption, approximately 1 to 1.5 kilowatts for a 30,000 BTU/hour capacity.
	* * The system can achieve up to 90% efficiency with optimal configurations.

* Specific construction details enhance the system's effectiveness and adaptability.
	* * The heat exchanger features an array of tubular members with grooves to improve water distribution and evaporation.
	* * Variations in air flow paths and recirculation options allow for tailored cooling solutions based on climatic conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The application claims the benefit of a prior U.S. patent application.
	* It focuses on pumps designed for fluid transfer, particularly liquid manure.
	* The need for improved pumps capable of high flow rates and pressures is highlighted.

* The fluid pump design includes multiple pump heads in series.
	* Each pump head contains an impeller and conduits for fluid movement.
	* The design allows for modularity and ease of maintenance.

* The drive structure connects the impellers of the pump heads.
	* It can consist of one or more drive shafts powered by a single motor.
	* The drive structure is designed to protect against fluid contamination.

* Various configurations of pump heads are described.
	* The pump heads can be connected in different arrangements to increase pressure.
	* Each head has specific features to facilitate fluid flow and impeller operation.

* The pump assembly can be mounted on different support structures.
	* Examples include wheeled booms, hitching assemblies, and trailers.
	* These structures enable the pump to be submerged in fluid reservoirs for operation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to engine compression release brakes that operate on fewer than all engine cylinders.  
    • Traditional systems use an engine brake for each cylinder, leading to excess components.  
    • The invention aims to reduce components while maintaining effective braking horsepower.  
    • It includes methods for attaching brakes to a portion of the cylinders and operating them in a braking mode.  

• The engine features a hydraulic system controlled by an electronic control module for efficient operation.  
    • A high-pressure pump delivers oil to a hydraulic system, with oil returned to a low-pressure reservoir.  
    • Engine compression release brakes are connected to specific cylinders, allowing selective braking.  
    • The system can be modified for different engine configurations and braking requirements.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to support structures, specifically a mounting link between an engine and an auxiliary gearbox.  
    • The mounting link is designed to absorb extreme loads from events like blade-off incidents.  
    • Conventional gearboxes often require additional material to withstand such loads, increasing weight.  
• The link assembly includes a male link, a female link, and a pin for retention.  
    • The female link allows translation of the male link, forming a radial interface.  
    • This interface dampens movement between the links to reduce shock transmission.  
• The gearbox assembly connects to the engine and includes various connections for torque transmission.  
    • It features driveshaft and peripheral load connections for auxiliary systems.  
    • The assembly constrains the gearbox in all six degrees of freedom without over-constraining.  
• The mounting link can break under extreme loads, allowing controlled movement.  
    • The pin can shear to permit relative motion between the male and female links.  
    • This design helps prevent damage to the gearbox and maintains attachment to the engine.  
• The radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy during translation.  
    • The damping force can be adjusted based on material and geometry.  
    • This feature allows the system to handle loads without requiring all components to withstand extreme forces.  
• Maintenance is simplified as the pin can be replaced after a shear event.  
    • The design reduces the need for heavy reinforcements in the gearbox assembly.  
    • It allows for easier repairs following incidents that cause pin failure.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a new system for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts, addressing issues with prior art such as stress on the shaft and dirt entry.
	* The system includes a lightweight point cap and balance pin that allow for adjustable weight and perfect balance of the arrow.
* The design features external threads on the point cap to reduce stress on the arrow shaft and allows for easy replacement if damaged.
	* Additionally, it includes a nock cap adaptor and means for encapsulating the arrow shaft end for improved durability.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for military training.
    • It aims to enhance realism in battlefield training conditions.
    • The device is designed for use with small arms, specifically the M16 automatic weapon.
    • It eliminates the need for blanks and blank fire adapters, reducing training costs.
    • The simulator operates without modifying the weapon, using electrical switches for activation.

• The system includes a low-cost plastic housing containing pyrotechnic charges and an electrical ignition system.
    • The housing is designed to fit into the weapon's magazine breech.
    • It produces sound and flash effects by igniting pyrotechnics in a confined space.
    • The combustion gases are vented through the weapon's ejection port.
    • The device supports both automatic and semi-automatic firing modes.

• The electrical control circuit consists of multiple functional blocks for realistic operation.
    • Key components include a bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillators, and firing control.
    • The circuit uses various electronic components, including CMOS ICs and SCRs.
    • It simulates operator actions during live fire through a microswitch connected to the weapon's bolt.
    • The system is designed to prevent accidental firing when the weapon is not in use.

• The expendable pyrotechnic charges are designed for cost-effective production and use.
    • Each charge is housed in a cup and ignited by a bridge wire.
    • The pyrotechnic composition includes potassium perchlorate and aluminum.
    • The design allows for rapid pressure buildup and controlled venting to simulate gunfire.
    • The entire assembly is encased in a durable plastic casing for safety and reliability.

• The invention aims to provide a reliable, low-maintenance training device for military applications.
    • It enhances training realism without the dangers associated with live ammunition.
    • The simulator is reusable and designed for easy integration with existing weapon systems.
    • It offers a cost-effective alternative to traditional training methods using blanks.
    • The design allows for modifications and improvements based on user feedback and technological advancements.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides an air intake device for internal combustion engines that enhances performance while reducing noise.
	• The device includes a tank, two interconnected pipes with different cross-sectional areas, and a control valve that operates based on engine load conditions.
• The design aims to optimize volumetric efficiency and minimize intake noise through a resonator effect created by the tank and narrow passage.
	• The control system adjusts the valve operation based on engine speed and load, ensuring optimal performance across various conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a two-part mounting bracket for speakers and equipment.
	• It allows for easy installation on various surfaces by a single person.
  
• The prior art involves pipe clamps that require different sizes for different poles.
	• This often necessitates two installers to hold and tighten the equipment simultaneously.

• The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket.
	• The adjustable bracket can be positioned conveniently before securing it to the stationary bracket.

• The design includes features for easy aiming and adjustment of mounted objects.
	• It utilizes tapered springs and integrated hooks for simple connection and adjustment.

• The assembly is suitable for various applications, including speakers, lighting, and cameras.
	• It is designed to be weather-resistant and made from durable materials like stainless steel.
</summary>

<summary>
• The disclosure introduces a modular burner system designed for various heat-utilizing appliances.
	• The burner features a combustion chamber with a fuel holder, air flow mechanisms for efficient combustion, and a removable ash pan.

• The burner allows for the attachment of multiple appliances, including cookers, food smokers, space heaters, and pyrolyzers.
	• It includes manual couplings and safety features like a cover to prevent accidental contact with hot surfaces.

• The design emphasizes efficiency and reduced emissions by promoting secondary and tertiary combustion of solid fuels.
	• The system incorporates features like an air damper and a fuel feed mechanism for continuous operation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention addresses the cooling and ignition system of rotary internal combustion engines to enhance fuel economy and durability.
	* * It focuses on improving the cooling characteristics around spark plug bosses to reduce thermal distortion and structural failures.
	* * The design incorporates staggered spark plug bosses to optimize coolant flow and heat transfer efficiency.

* The arrangement of spark plug bosses is critical for effective combustion and cooling.
	* * Dual in-line spark plugs are used to ensure complete combustion of the air-fuel mixture, but their arrangement can disrupt cooling flow.
	* * The staggered configuration of the bosses allows for better coolant velocity distribution and reduces vapor accumulation.

* Experimental results demonstrate significant improvements in heat transfer coefficients with the staggered design.
	* * The staggered arrangement increased the heat transfer coefficient by up to 44% compared to the in-line configuration.
	* * This design leads to a more uniform temperature distribution across the combustion surface, enhancing engine performance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on minimizing flow disturbances in turbines during control valve testing.
	* It utilizes control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant mass flow and minimize pressure changes.
* Existing methods for managing inlet pressure changes are limited and cannot be modified due to design constraints.
	* The proposed method improves performance by relying solely on valve position without needing additional process parameters.
* The flow characteristics for turbine control valves are determined during the design process and are essential for compensation calculations.
	* The method adjusts the flow demands based on the closure of valves during testing to maintain system stability.
* Experimental results demonstrate a significant reduction in pressure excursions during valve testing with the proposed compensation method.
	* The control system showed a 95% reduction in pressure changes compared to tests without flow compensation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to mixing valves for combining fluids.
    * Specifically designed for aircraft cleaning apparatus.
    * Features two inlets (A and B) and one outlet.
    * Mixture can range from 0% A fluid to 100% B fluid and vice versa.
    * 
* Existing cleaning apparatuses utilize various mechanisms for fluid mixing.
    * Examples include garden hoses and public car wash systems.
    * Previous patents detail similar mixing systems for different applications.
    * The invention aims to improve efficiency in commercial airline cleaning.
    
* The mixing valve includes a valve body with defined passages.
    * First inlet for soap solution at a predetermined pressure.
    * Second inlet for water at a higher predetermined pressure.
    * Outlet passage provides a proportional mixture of the two fluids.
    
* The valve means is adjustable for continuous analog control.
    * Allows users to select desired cleaning solution strength.
    * Ensures constant pressure for effective cleaning.
    * Designed for multiple users without disrupting operations.
    
* The valve body is constructed from durable materials.
    * Example materials include 304 stainless steel.
    * Features various threaded passages for fluid connections.
    * Includes a flow restricting device to manage fluid flow rates.
    
* The valve assembly consists of several components.
    * Includes a cylindrical valve member for directing fluid flow.
    * Sealing sleeves and fluid seal rings prevent leakage.
    * The design allows for easy assembly and maintenance.
    
* The operation of the valve system is described in detail.
    * Rotational movement of the valve adjusts fluid proportions.
    * Mechanisms prevent backflow to protect fluid sources.
    * Achieves a range of mixtures from 0% to 100% of either fluid.
    
* The invention allows for efficient operation of multiple systems.
    * Maintains constant fluid pressures at the inlets.
    * Reduces fluid demand through design features.
    * Supports effective cleaning operations in commercial settings.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a gas compression method for pipelines in frost areas.
    • The method compresses gas to a higher pressure and cools it before transportation.
    • The exit temperature is maintained at or below 0° C.
    • The invention also includes an arrangement for implementing this method.

• Current gas transportation faces challenges in permanent frost areas.
    • Compressor stations are needed to counteract pressure loss in long pipelines.
    • Conventional cooling methods are expensive and underutilized.
    • Safety risks arise from using flammable cooling agents like propane.

• The proposed method reduces investment and operational risks.
    • Gas is compressed to an excess pressure above the desired exit pressure.
    • Cooling occurs through heat exchange, followed by expansion to the exit pressure.
    • This method allows for efficient temperature reduction during warmer months.

• The compressor station design includes multiple stages of compression.
    • Two primary compression stages are used, followed by a booster compressor.
    • Heat exchangers cool the gas between compression stages.
    • Expansion turbines recover energy during the cooling process.

• The system can adapt to seasonal changes in temperature and gas demand.
    • During winter, the system operates with fewer compressors due to lower cooling needs.
    • In summer, additional compressors and expansion turbines are utilized.
    • The design allows for flexibility in operation based on environmental conditions.

• The invention enhances the efficiency of gas compression stations.
    • It reduces the need for expensive re-cooling plants.
    • The overall investment is estimated to be 40-45% lower than conventional methods.
    • The risk of accidents is minimized by eliminating hazardous cooling agents.

• The invention is not limited to the described embodiments.
    • Various modifications can be made within the scope of the patent claims.
    • The focus remains on improving gas compression efficiency and safety.
    • The method is applicable to long-distance gas pipelines in various climates.
</summary>

<summary>
• Electronic components generate heat that requires effective cooling methods.  
    • Free convection cooling is sometimes insufficient for heat removal.  
    • Electric fans are commonly used to enhance air movement for cooling.  
    • Cooling fans help maintain acceptable temperature ranges for components.  
• Traditional fastening methods for cooling fans increase product costs.  
    • Fasteners like screws and rivets require labor and tools for installation.  
    • Handling costs associated with fasteners also contribute to overall expenses.  
    • The need for a more efficient mounting system is highlighted.  
    • The invention aims to eliminate the need for traditional fasteners.  
• The cooling fan assembly can be used in various applications.  
    • It is applicable in automotive, computer, and electronic instrumentation industries.  
    • The assembly is designed for forced air cooling systems.  
    • It can be adapted for any heat-generating system.  
    • The design allows for easy integration with existing enclosures.  
• The installation process of the cooling fan assembly is detailed.  
    • The assembly moves through distinct positions: load, partially installed, and fully installed.  
    • Each position involves specific movements and forces applied to the assembly.  
    • The design includes resilient legs that secure the fan in place.  
    • Spring members help maintain tension and prevent disengagement during operation.  
• Various modifications to the cooling fan assembly are possible.  
    • The spring member can take different forms while still providing an urging force.  
    • The invention is flexible and can accommodate various design changes.  
    • The focus remains on maintaining effective cooling without traditional fasteners.  
    • The claims of the invention cover all fair equivalents of the described embodiments.  
</summary>

<summary>
* Background of the Invention
	* * Spacecraft structures require lightweight composite materials for efficiency.
	* * These materials lack inherent damping, leading to high vibration levels.
	* * Kinematic mounts (KMs) used for instruments have minimal damping, risking functionality.

* Need for Vibration Reduction Techniques
	* * Ongoing efforts aim to modify graphite structures to reduce vibration.
	* * Current modifications may not sufficiently protect instruments.
	* * Additional vibration reduction techniques are necessary for instrument safety.

* Kinematic Mount Design Challenges
	* * Conventional KMs provide limited success in minimizing loads on instruments.
	* * Six suspension modes in KMs have low damping, amplifying flight loads.
	* * A need exists for innovative designs that incorporate damping features.

* Objectives of the Invention
	* * Introduce kinematic mounts with passive energy dissipating mechanisms.
	* * Simplify manufacturing by using six identical strut elements.
	* * Achieve significant modal damping improvements over existing designs.

* Damped Instrument Kinematic Mounts
	* * Modified mounts include vibration damping materials to dissipate energy.
	* * Damping mechanisms are integrated at flexural hinge locations.
	* * The design preserves strength, stiffness, and kinematic features.

* Damper Design Embodiments
	* * A spherical damper design utilizes viscoelastic materials for energy dissipation.
	* * A cylindrical slot damper employs o-rings for compression/tension damping.
	* * Both designs significantly enhance damping performance compared to untreated mounts.

* Alternative Mounting Concepts
	* * Truss structures may be used for efficient stiffness-to-weight ratios.
	* * Damped versions of existing mount configurations can be implemented.
	* * The design allows for various configurations to suit different instruments.

* Center-of-Gravity Mounting System
	* * Struts can be arranged to intersect at the instrument's center of mass.
	* * This configuration helps uncouple suspension vibration modes.
	* * Uncoupled modes reduce rotational disturbances during dynamic operations.

* Conclusion
	* * The invention enables the use of damped kinematic mounts for instrument protection.
	* * Various modifications and equivalents can be made without departing from the invention's scope.
	* * The proposed designs enhance instrument stability and performance during flight.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to large oil shear type clutch units, particularly for aircraft catapult systems.
	* It aims to improve coupling forces, control accuracy, and reduce residual drag in high horsepower applications.
* The clutch unit features interleaved clutch plates and discs, with separate piston and cylinder means for each disc segment.
	* This design minimizes residual drag and allows for effective cooling through hydraulic fluid.
* The construction allows for easy replacement of clutch disc segments without complete disassembly of the unit.
	* This is achieved through a segmental arrangement and removable fasteners that hold the segments in place.
* The system includes a sophisticated fluid control mechanism to manage pressure and flow rates for optimal performance.
	* It utilizes multiple pumps and amplifiers to ensure precise control in response to varying operational conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an internal combustion engine design that incorporates both combustion and expansion cylinders.
	*	* The system aims to improve thermal efficiency by utilizing exhaust gases and water injection to drive expansion cylinders, potentially eliminating the need for a radiator.
	*	* Features include catalytic materials for exhaust purification and mechanisms for water recovery and reuse within the engine system.

* Various configurations of the engine are proposed, including multi-stage cascades of expansion cylinders.
	*	* These configurations allow for significant heat and energy recapture, reducing thermal losses typically associated with conventional engines.
	*	* The design can accommodate different types of combustion cylinders and fuels, enhancing versatility.

* The engine's operation is optimized through advanced control systems for water injection and ignition timing.
	*	* This optimization helps maintain desired temperatures and improves overall efficiency, potentially achieving thermal-to-mechanical efficiencies of 94-96%.
	*	* The system is designed to minimize emissions and maximize useful energy output, addressing environmental concerns.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method for fabricating coated steel plates for automotive parts.
	* The process aims to achieve high mechanical strength and corrosion resistance while preventing the formation of intermetallic areas during welding.
* The fabrication involves a steel substrate with a precoat of intermetallic alloy and metal alloy layers.
	* The metal alloy layer is partially removed at the periphery before welding to avoid contamination of the molten area.
* The method allows for butt-welding of plates with varying compositions and thicknesses.
	* This results in welded blanks that can be heat-treated to produce parts with tailored mechanical properties.
* Experimental results demonstrate that the invention provides satisfactory ductility and corrosion resistance in welded joints.
	* The method outperforms traditional techniques by eliminating harmful intermetallic areas and maintaining protective coatings.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system for remote control of mobile structures that extract energy from marine environments.  
    • The system optimizes energy recovery by using algorithms that analyze weather data and vessel performance.  
    • It allows for navigation adjustments based on wind and water conditions.  
    • The system is designed to operate in hazardous environments, reducing risks to human crews.  
• The SCADA system integrates various data sources, including satellites and weather services.  
    • It utilizes GPS for tracking the position and velocity of mobile structures.  
    • Weather data is sourced from entities like NASA and NOAA.  
    • Communication is facilitated through telecommunications satellites and potentially other wireless systems.  
• The mobile structure can include various energy recovery systems, such as hydrokinetic turbines or wind turbines on floating platforms.  
    • The design aims to overcome limitations of stationary energy systems.  
    • It allows for mobility and adaptability in energy extraction.  
    • The system can also track and respond to severe weather patterns.  
• The control system includes a microprocessor for managing inputs and outputs from various sensors.  
    • Sensors monitor vessel stability, wind conditions, and energy extraction efficiency.  
    • The microprocessor executes control algorithms for navigation and energy recovery.  
    • It can communicate with a central service facility for data aggregation and analysis.  
• The graphical user interface (GUI) allows human operators to interact with the SCADA system.  
    • Operators can monitor vessel performance and adjust navigation parameters.  
    • The GUI displays real-time data on position, heading, and energy extraction efficiency.  
    • It supports decision-making for optimal energy recovery routes.  
• The invention emphasizes flexibility and adaptability in energy extraction systems.  
    • It is not limited to specific implementations and can be adapted for various mobile structures.  
    • The system can be modified to suit different operational needs and environments.  
    • It aims to enhance the economic feasibility of renewable energy recovery from marine sources.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a rolling body guide cage.
	* * It is produced from at least one ring element and multiple guide structures for rolling bodies.
	* * A method for manufacturing this guide cage is also described.
* Prior art includes a ball bearing cage from DE 1 625 540 A1.
	* * This cage consists of two identical axially profiled ring elements.
	* * It suffers from significant waste material during production.
* The invention aims to reduce production costs of rolling body guide cages.
	* * It introduces a design using flat material ring segments.
	* * These segments are joined and welded before axial profiling.
* The design minimizes cutting waste during manufacturing.
	* * It is particularly effective for cages with an internal diameter over 140 mm.
	* * The process costs are lower than the material costs from cutting waste.
* The flat material ring segments are preferably 120° segments.
	* * They can be punched out in close succession from a sheet metal strip.
	* * Only three weld points are needed to join the segments.
* The method includes laser welding for strong connections.
	* * This technique reduces welding distortion.
	* * Alternative pressure welding methods can also be used.
* The invention is applicable for both radial and axial bearing cages.
	* * It allows for mirror-symmetrical assembly of ring elements.
	* * Weld points are offset to enhance structural integrity.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to methods and systems for improving customer service in telecommunications by utilizing global satellite positioning to accurately identify service locations and provide efficient routing for service technicians.  
	* This includes obtaining latitude and longitude coordinates for customer service locations and generating driving directions between multiple service locations to enhance response times and reduce errors.  
* The system comprises various components, including a technician input device, a technician server, a GPS system, a dispatch system, an address guide system, and a customer record system, all working together to streamline service operations.  
	* These components facilitate the collection, processing, and transmission of location-related information to ensure timely and effective customer service.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields.
	* It utilizes two triaxial magnetic field sensors and three pairs of compensation coils.
	* The control unit processes signals to protect an object from interfering fields.

* The system addresses challenges in measuring and compensating both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields.
	* It employs a virtual sensor to simulate measurements at the object's location.
	* Feedback effects between adjacent compensation systems are managed through a cross-coupling matrix.

* The control algorithms are flexible, allowing for various configurations and adjustments.
	* The system can adapt to changes in the interfering field without requiring extensive recalibration.
	* Nonlinear control algorithms can be implemented for improved performance.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for investigating biological samples using CARS microscopy.  
	• This method utilizes coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering to generate resonance signals from the sample.  
• The method improves upon existing CARS microscopy techniques by introducing bioorthogonal reactions.  
	• These reactions allow for the creation of resonance sites that may not naturally exist in the sample.  
• CARS microscopy is noted for its higher sensitivity and better suppression of background noise compared to conventional Raman microscopy.  
	• It enables species-selective imaging without the need for additional tagging or dyes.  
• The invention allows for the tagging of biological samples, enhancing the specificity of imaging.  
	• This is particularly useful for analyzing complex biological structures, such as nerve tissue.  
• Bioorthogonal reactions are defined as chemical reactions that do not interfere with natural biological processes.  
	• They can be performed in living systems without causing cell damage.  
• The method involves a two-step process: introducing a bioorthogonal functional group and then a tagging substance.  
	• This results in the synthesis of resonance sites that can be detected using CARS microscopy.  
• The invention aims to provide a reproducible and defined background signal for improved imaging results.  
	• This allows for better quantitative analysis and specificity in detecting target sites within samples.  
• Various bioorthogonal reactions, such as cycloadditions and Staudinger ligation, are highlighted as advantageous for this method.  
	• These reactions facilitate the introduction of resonance sites into the sample for enhanced imaging capabilities.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The application claims benefit from a prior provisional application.  
    • It was filed on May 30, 2008.  
    • The prior application is incorporated by reference.  
 
• The invention relates to medical equipment for radiation therapy.  
    • It focuses on accurately controlling radiation dosage.  
    • The goal is to destroy tumors while minimizing damage to healthy tissue.  

• External radiation therapy uses an external source to treat internal tumors.  
    • Radiation sources include linear accelerators and radioisotopes.  
    • Treatment typically involves multiple beams from different angles.  

• Advanced radiation delivery modalities have been developed.  
    • These modalities customize treatment plans for better accuracy.  
    • Techniques include beamlet modulation and robotic arms.  

• Treatment plans are based on digitized virtual models of patient anatomy.  
    • Volumetric medical imaging techniques like CT and MRI are used.  
    • Segmentation of tumor and sensitive areas is crucial for planning.  

• Segmentation can be done manually or through automated programs.  
    • Various software systems are available for segmentation.  
    • Results are stored in DICOM-RT Structure Set files.  

• The invention provides a system for assessing segmentations.  
    • It compares clinician-approved segmentations with others.  
    • The system identifies missing or extra volume elements.  

• The apparatus uses electronic files to generate volume models.  
    • It compares these models to assess segmentation quality.  
    • Outputs indicate the quality of one segmentation relative to another.  

• The system allows for customized metric methods for evaluation.  
    • Users can define parameters for assessing segmentation quality.  
    • It provides visual outputs to assist in improving segmentation skills.  

• The invention is applicable for training and quality assurance in radiation therapy.  
    • It can evaluate autosegmentation routines and new imaging technologies.  
    • The system helps determine if new treatment plans are needed based on anatomical changes.  
</summary>

<summary>
• Related U.S. Patent Applications
    • • Two patent applications related to floating point operations are mentioned.
    • • Inventors include Sridhar Samudrala, Victor Peng, and others.
    • • Both applications are assigned to the same assignee as the present invention.

• Background of the Invention
    • • The invention pertains to data processing systems and floating point operations.
    • • Floating point format allows manipulation of a wide range of numerical quantities.
    • • The complexity of addition and subtraction in floating point format is highlighted.

• Need for Acceleration
    • • The execution of floating point addition and subtraction is time-consuming.
    • • A procedure to accelerate effective subtraction operations is needed.
    • • The invention aims to improve the efficiency of floating point operations.

• Features of the Invention
    • • Improved apparatus for executing floating point operations is proposed.
    • • The technique focuses on accelerating effective subtraction operations.
    • • Utilizes differences in operand exponent arguments to enhance performance.

• Summary of the Invention
    • • The invention provides a method for early initiation of subtraction operations.
    • • It calculates a subset difference before the complete exponent difference is available.
    • • This approach allows for quicker determination of the final fraction result.

• Description of the Preferred Embodiment
    • • The effective subtraction operation is divided based on the exponent difference.
    • • Two main cases are considered: when the absolute difference is greater than or less than one.
    • • The preferred embodiment includes specific steps to optimize the subtraction process.

• Apparatus Implementation
    • • A block diagram illustrates the apparatus for executing the invention.
    • • The apparatus includes subtraction units and logic units for processing exponent differences.
    • • Control signals guide the selection of operand fractions and results.

• Operation of the Preferred Embodiment
    • • The method accelerates subtraction by using a subset of exponent signals.
    • • It allows for simultaneous calculation of fraction differences while determining complete differences.
    • • The final result is derived efficiently based on the availability of operand fractions.

• Conclusion
    • • The description outlines the invention's operation without limiting its scope.
    • • Variations in implementation are possible while adhering to the invention's spirit.
    • • The invention aims to enhance the performance of floating point operations in data processing systems.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention addresses the issue of mislabeling medical specimens in hospitals.
    • The current methods often lead to errors despite training and automation.
    • The invention proposes a system that utilizes machine-readable codes for tracking specimens.
    • It emphasizes the importance of verifying patient identity and matching it with specimen labels.
    • The system aims to improve accuracy and reduce liability in specimen collection.

• The method involves a series of steps for collecting and tracking specimens.
    • It includes storing machine-readable codes for patients, orders, and specimen containers.
    • The process ensures that all codes are related to the same patient before proceeding.
    • It utilizes electronic reading means to confirm and store information in a relational database.
    • The goal is to create a failsafe process that minimizes errors and enhances efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device designed for golfers, integrating GPS and voice recognition technologies.  
    • The device can be incorporated into headgear, such as hats, and provides verbal information about golf course parameters, allowing users to receive data hands-free.  
• It features a printed circuit board assembly that includes a bone conductance vibration sensor for improved voice recognition and can connect via Bluetooth for data transfer and communication.  
    • The device also allows users to record and share golf course data, enhancing the golfing experience through personalized recommendations and strategic insights.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention addresses challenges in semiconductor design verification.
    * The design rule check (DRC) process ensures compliance with fabrication rules.
    * Existing methods often produce false errors, especially in mixed logic and memory designs.
    * The invention proposes a system that applies appropriate rules to different circuit types.
    * Customized design rules are created by modifying standard logic rules for memory regions.

* The proposed method improves accuracy and efficiency in error detection.
    * It categorizes errors based on the type of circuit (logic or memory).
    * The system reduces manual checking and the risk of overlooking real errors.
    * It allows for the creation of tailored rules for various memory types.
    * The approach can be implemented on conventional computing systems using existing software routines.
</summary>

<summary>
• Government support and rights
	• • Invention made under contract F300606-88-D-0025.
	• • Continuation-in-part of U.S. Patent application Ser. No. 07/790,516.

• Field of the invention
	• • Use of waveguide holograms for specific illumination requirements.
	• • Particularly applicable to display holograms and spatial light modulators.

• Background of the prior invention
	• • Thin substrate waveguides characterized by specific relationships between beam width and thickness.
	• • Conventional illumination systems face challenges in space, alignment, and efficiency.

• Summary of the invention
	• • Thin substrate waveguides provide controlled illumination with high diffraction efficiencies.
	• • Non-uniformity in diffracted wavefront can be corrected using photographic emulsions or non-uniform hologram recording.

• Advantages of waveguide holograms (WGH)
	• • Compact and rugged compared to conventional lens systems.
	• • High diffraction efficiency and minimal stray light.

• Challenges with WGHs
	• • Critical alignment of laser beams can affect ruggedness.
	• • Nonuniformity of diffracted wavefront and two-sidedness can reduce efficiency.

• Compensation methods
	• • A posteriori compensation is less efficient; a priori compensation can achieve uniformity.
	• • Solutions for two-sidedness include absorption or reflection techniques.

• Experimental configurations
	• • Two architectures used for recording WGH gratings.
	• • Experiments demonstrated flexibility and convenience in illuminating spatial light modulators.

• Quality analysis of reconstructed beams
	• • Emphasis on polarization and phase characteristics.
	• • Observed nonuniform depolarization linked to local strains.
</summary>

<summary>
• Invention Overview
    • The invention pertains to testing rotors of dynamoelectric machines.
    • Focuses on squirrel cage rotors for induction motors.
    • Aims to identify rotor defects through resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew measurements.
    • Addresses the need for economical and reliable testing methods.

• Background and Need
    • Squirrel cage rotors are mass-produced but can have defects.
    • Common issues include porosity, open circuits, and poor insulation.
    • High-quality control requires low-cost tests on each rotor.
    • Existing methods have limitations, including reliance on stator cores or destructive testing.

• Objectives of the Invention
    • Provide a non-destructive testing method for dynamoelectric machine rotors.
    • Enable measurement of resistance, reactance, and effective skew.
    • Facilitate automatic pass/fail determinations for rotors.
    • Offer detailed statistical evaluations of measurement results.

• Testing Apparatus Description
    • The apparatus includes a test head for rotor testing.
    • Features exciting means for magnetizing the rotor.
    • Voltage and current sensing means generate signals for analysis.
    • Processing means calculates resistance, reactance, and skew.

• Test Procedure
    • The rotor is rotated within the test head during testing.
    • Voltage and current signals are sampled synchronously.
    • Data is processed to determine rotor characteristics.
    • Results are compared against predetermined thresholds.

• Statistical Analysis
    • The system stores data for statistical evaluation.
    • Calculates averages, dissymmetry, and skew dissymmetry.
    • Provides insights into rotor quality over multiple tests.
    • Results can be displayed or printed for review.

• Mechanical Structure
    • The test fixture includes a retraction and drive mechanism.
    • A spindle holds the rotor securely during testing.
    • A clutch mechanism ensures the rotor is held in place.
    • The design allows for easy rotor placement and secure testing.

• Conclusion
    • The invention offers a novel approach to rotor testing.
    • It enhances quality control in dynamoelectric machine manufacturing.
    • The method is adaptable to various rotor designs.
    • Future modifications and variations are anticipated within the invention's scope.
</summary>

<summary>
* Mobile device security is enhanced by restricting access to native resources through managed libraries.
	* A manager validates digital certificates to grant or deny access to these resources.
	* Third-party applications can execute in a controlled environment, ensuring they do not compromise device integrity.

* The ecosystem provider plays a crucial role in application development and validation.
	* Developers use a software development kit to create applications that are submitted for validation.
	* Verified applications are stored in digitally signed containers to ensure authenticity before distribution.

* An arbitration layer is implemented to manage interactions between managed applications and the operating system.
	* This layer checks permissions and enforces security policies to prevent unauthorized access.
	* It allows trusted libraries to interact with the operating system while keeping untrusted code isolated.
</summary>

<summary>
* Improved identification card design
	* * Contains internal antenna and integrated circuit chip
	* * Laminated between protective non-rigid layers
	* * Rigid outer layers provide structural support

* Issues with prior art smart cards
	* * Rigid components prone to damage from bending
	* * Complicated assembly processes increase production costs
	* * Materials can become brittle over time, leading to cracking

* Unique structure of the invention
	* * Incorporates shock-absorbing layers
	* * Rigid outer layers distribute external forces
	* * Protects delicate electronic components from damage

* Core layer composition
	* * Made from silica-filled polyolefin
	* * Provides a bright white background for printing
	* * Preferred material is TESLIN® sheet

* Manufacturing process overview
	* * Core layer is pre-shrunk before component attachment
	* * Alkyd resin spids printed to minimize damage risk
	* * Antennae and IC chips are attached using conventional methods

* Lamination and adhesive layers
	* * Two polymer layers provide mechanical strength
	* * Adhesive layers improve adhesion and protect components
	* * Thickness of polymer layers typically ranges from 0.1 mm to 0.225 mm

* Image-receiving layer functionality
	* * Capable of receiving images via dye diffusion thermal transfer
	* * May include multiple layers for enhanced printing options
	* * Can be personalized with inkjet printing

* Security features of the card
	* * Protective layers prevent damage and dye bleeding
	* * May include low cohesivity layers or optically variable inks
	* * Designed to resist tampering and counterfeiting

* Examples of card preparation
	* * Detailed steps for creating core and bottom layers
	* * Personalization methods using inkjet printing
	* * Final assembly includes lamination and application of security features
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a memory implementation, specifically a FIFO queue in functional memories.
	* The queue is structured as a tree to minimize copying during updates.
	* Updates require copying only the path from the root to the update point, leading to logarithmic time complexity.
	* The tree structure maintains balance and allows efficient additions and deletions.

* A header node is introduced to enhance the queue's functionality.
	* The header node contains pointers to the beginning and end of the queue and the tree structure.
	* This allows for faster updates and less memory usage during additions and deletions.
	* The queue can be inverted in constant time by changing an identifier in the header node.

* The tree structure ensures all leaf nodes are at the same level and internal nodes are full.
	* Additions fill non-full leaf nodes first, maintaining the balance of the tree.
	* Deletions occur from the rightmost leaf node, ensuring efficient memory management.
	* The structure can also function as a double-ended queue (deque).

* The memory arrangement includes registers and control logic for managing the queue.
	* Intermediate registers store the leaf nodes for the beginning and end of the queue.
	* The control logic handles record additions and deletions, updating the tree as necessary.
	* The system allows for efficient record management while maintaining the integrity of the queue structure.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on developing embedded EPROM devices using existing integrated circuit technologies.  
		• The goal is to create EPROM devices compatible with DRAM redundancy circuits and standard logic technologies.  
		• Current EPROM devices require high voltages and specialized manufacturing processes, making them impractical for integration with other circuits.  
		
• The proposed EPROM devices utilize existing DRAM manufacturing techniques, allowing for simultaneous production of DRAM and EPROM on the same wafer.  
		• This approach significantly reduces manufacturing costs and simplifies the production process.  
		• The coupling capacitors in the new EPROM devices are larger, improving performance and reducing operational voltages by nearly 50%.  
		
• The invention also introduces SEPROM devices, which leverage electrical stress effects on transistors for data storage.  
		• SEPROM devices can be manufactured using any IC technology, making them suitable for embedded applications and security purposes.  
		• However, they may have slower write times and limited re-programmability due to the accumulative nature of stress damage.  
</summary>

<summary>
* Overview of Feedback Control
	* Feedback control is used to guide automatic vehicles along a predetermined path.
	* It involves detecting errors, calculating corrections, and adjusting steering repeatedly.
	* Various systems (P, PI, PD, PID) utilize different feedback gains (P, I, D) to influence control characteristics.

* Challenges in Determining Feedback Gains
	* Traditional methods like the limit sensitivity process can be impractical.
	* Detecting self-sustaining vibrations can be difficult, especially in slow-moving vehicles.
	* There is a need for a more efficient method to determine optimal feedback gains.

* Proposed Method for Feedback Gain Determination
	* The method involves iterative steps to evaluate and adjust feedback gains.
	* Evaluation values are calculated based on the error detected during control execution.
	* The process aims to quickly and accurately find suitable feedback gains for stability, accuracy, and response.

* Implementation in Automatic Guidance Vehicles (AGVs)
	* The method is applied to AGVs, with specific control systems and sensors.
	* Evaluation functions are defined to assess the P, I, and D gains based on control performance.
	* The procedure includes data collection and gain optimization for different sections of the running course.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to zoom lenses with enhanced relative aperture and optical performance.
	* * It aims to minimize physical size while maintaining suitability for cameras.
* There is a demand for zoom lenses that balance high relative aperture and compactness.
	* * Video cameras require high relative apertures due to lower sensitivity of image pickup elements.
* The 2/3 inch image pickup tube is commonly used for its compactness and image quality.
	* * Smaller 8 mm video cameras are increasingly utilizing 1/2 inch image pickup tubes.
* A 4-unit zoom lens design can achieve a relative aperture of 1.4-1.6 with proper lens design rules.
	* * The design focuses on the fourth lens unit's stationary position during zooming.
* Reducing the size of the first lens unit can shorten the total lens length.
	* * However, increasing refractive power can lead to increased aberrations.
* Prior art indicates that total lens length is typically between 10φA to 12φA.
	* * Achieving a length shorter than 10φA while maintaining performance is challenging.
* The invention provides a zoom lens with a small F-number and high zoom ratio.
	* * It includes specific lens unit configurations to correct aberrations effectively.
* Conditions for lens design are specified to ensure high optical performance.
	* * These include ratios of refractive power and Abbe numbers for lens materials.
* The fourth and fifth lens units are designed to balance aberration correction.
	* * Specific lens shapes and curvatures are recommended for optimal performance.
* Numerical examples demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed lens configurations.
	* * Total lengths achieved range from 9.13φA to 9.19φA, indicating significant size reduction.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles.
	* The method generates a charge pulse in a detector when a particle passes through and converts it into an electric signal.
* The device includes a detector and amplification devices for processing signals.
	* It features a fast amplifier for individual signals and a slow amplifier for integrating multiple signals.
* Current methods struggle to detect both individual particles and integrate signals simultaneously.
	* The invention allows for detection without prior knowledge of expected signal rates.
* The method improves signal detection by discharging on the low-voltage side of the detector.
	* This approach enhances the signal-to-noise ratio and prevents interference from leakage currents.
* The device can detect charged and uncharged particles using converter materials.
	* Doped or coated detector materials generate electric pulses for uncharged particles.
* Fast charge transport materials, like diamond, are proposed for the detector.
	* These materials enable high-resolution detection and integration of signals.
* The invention is applicable in various fields, including particle accelerators and medical diagnostics.
	* It allows for monitoring and imaging processes while avoiding overdosing.
* The design includes features for separating and processing signals based on their rates.
	* Capacitors and inductive elements are used to manage high and low-rate signals effectively.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to an automatic apparatus for spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches.  
	• The apparatus aims to improve efficiency and reduce manual operations in testing.  
	• Clutches connect rotational power sources to driven mechanisms in vehicles.  
	• The driven disc assembly is crucial for engaging and disengaging the clutch.  
	• Previous testing methods were slow and lacked clear indications of assembly quality.  
	• The new apparatus includes a stationary and movable ring for frictional engagement.  
	• It utilizes a torque motor and electronic sensors to measure warpage and rotation.  
	• The system provides automatic results and visual alerts for operators regarding assembly quality.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The application claims priority from U.S. Provisional Patent Application Ser. No. 61/744,917.
	* It is titled “Contourlet Appearance Model” and is incorporated by reference.
* The invention relates to image processing, specifically face age-estimation.
	* It addresses challenges in face recognition and age-estimation due to variations in human faces.
* Accurate age-estimation has practical applications in various industries.
	* Examples include preventing underage access to restricted products and enhancing security measures.
* Aging of human faces is influenced by controllable and uncontrollable factors.
	* Factors include gender, ethnicity, environmental influences, and lifestyle choices.
* The invention proposes methods for face age-estimation and age-progression.
	* It utilizes unique information extraction from images for accurate age predictions.
* The disclosure includes a method for generating face age-estimation using image data.
	* It involves applying a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm and an age classifier.
* The CAM algorithm enhances feature extraction for age estimation.
	* It combines shape and texture modeling to improve accuracy.
* The training method involves a database of landmarked face images.
	* Feature vectors are extracted and used to construct aging functions and classifiers.
* The system can classify faces into age groups and estimate ages based on extracted features.
	* It employs support vector machines for classification and regression tasks.
* The computing system described can implement the methods and functionalities of the invention.
	* It includes components like processors, memory, and storage for executing software instructions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a matrix display device for merging two images.
    * It allows simultaneous display of images from different sources.
    * The device can handle images of varying definitions and types.
    * Examples include night vision and infrared images or X-ray and MRI images.
    * The merging process aims to preserve the higher definition image.

* The matrix display device consists of a pixel matrix and a controller.
    * Pixels can be formed by LCD, LED, or OLED technologies.
    * The controller generates light intensity signals for each pixel.
    * The device can implement various algorithms for image merging.
    * It can be configured to display monochrome or color images.

* Different arrangements of pixels can be used for displaying merged images.
    * Examples include arrangements of four pixels with specific signal assignments.
    * The arrangement can prioritize one image over the other based on definition.
    * Color filters may be used to enhance the display of the second image.
    * The controller can apply attenuation functions to adjust brightness.

* The invention proposes methods for improving image contrast and saturation.
    * Contrast reinforcement can enhance visibility of the second image.
    * Attenuation functions can be applied based on signal intensity.
    * Parameters for these functions can be adjusted for different applications.
    * The goal is to maintain clarity of the first image while displaying the second.

* Practical applications of the device include various imaging technologies.
    * Examples include combining night vision with graphical overlays.
    * The device can support different resolutions and refresh rates.
    * It can display multiple images simultaneously with dedicated pixel arrangements.
    * The architecture can be optimized for lower power consumption.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a mobile identification transmitter designed for activating a motor vehicle's security system.
	* It features a removable payment element housed within the transmitter, allowing for secure transactions while maintaining vehicle access functionality.
