* The transmitter can operate in two states: a normal state for communication with the vehicle's security system and a secure state where the payment element is removed.
	* In the secure state, the closure protects the receptacle, preventing unauthorized access and ensuring the integrity of the electronics.
* The payment element can facilitate cashless transactions and is equipped with a microprocessor for secure communication with payment systems.
	* It supports various payment functions, including credit and debit card capabilities, and can execute remote financial transactions.
* The design includes features to prevent moisture and dirt from affecting the electronics, ensuring reliable operation in both states.
	* The closure mechanism can be a dummy plug or a movable cap, providing effective sealing and protection for the internal components.
</summary>

<summary>
* Imaging devices, such as xerographic machines, enter a "sleep mode" to conserve energy when inactive.
    * The device warms up and resumes imaging operations upon waking.
    * Toner used in these devices is charged with a tribo-electro-static charge.
    * A toner concentration sensor measures toner levels and adjusts supply as needed.
    * Inactivity can lead to a decrease in toner charge, affecting image quality.

* Various methods and apparatuses are proposed to charge toner based on periods of inactivity.
    * These methods involve determining inactivity periods and measuring toner charge levels.
    * The charging process aims to restore toner charge to a predetermined level.
    * An intelligent system monitors user patterns to predict usage and adjust charging accordingly.
    * The system includes components for measuring, calculating decay, and updating usage patterns.

* Flowcharts illustrate processes for charging toner based on inactivity and sensor measurements.
    * The first method predicts user usage and calculates toner decay after inactivity.
    * The second method measures sensor levels before and after the machine becomes active.
    * If the decay exceeds a threshold, the toner is charged to ensure proper operation.
    * Both methods can be combined for more accurate toner charge adjustments.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to a high-precision recording/reproducing apparatus using magneto resistive (MR) heads.  
    • The apparatus allows for precise control of bias currents for multiple MR heads.  
    • It is particularly designed for rotary magnetic head systems.  
• MR heads require both detecting and bias currents for optimal performance.  
    • The bias current maintains the operating point in a linear region.  
    • Control signals for these currents are typically transmitted via rotary transformers.  
• The invention aims to simplify the structure while allowing independent regulation of bias currents.  
    • A control signal generator is placed on the stationary side.  
    • A decoder and current supply circuit are located on the rotary drum side.  
• The apparatus can switch between multiple MR heads efficiently.  
    • Control data for head switching is prioritized over other control data.  
    • This ensures timely and accurate switching to prevent signal loss.  
• Various embodiments illustrate different configurations of the apparatus.  
    • Some embodiments integrate regenerative amplifiers with current supply circuits.  
    • Others feature multiple recording and reproducing heads for increased data transfer rates.  
• The invention is applicable to both rotary magnetic head systems and disk apparatuses.  
    • It can also handle frequency-modulated analog signals.  
    • The design is flexible enough to accommodate various types of recording and reproducing systems.  
• The invention addresses challenges related to increased data transmission requirements.  
    • It prevents erroneous operations due to delays in data transmission.  
    • The structure allows for effective control even with a growing number of integrated circuits.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, like pipes or cables.  
	• It aims to improve the accuracy of locating one object when another is nearby.  
• Two techniques exist for locating buried metallic objects: passive and active.  
	• Passive uses magnetic locators, while active employs transmitters to induce currents in non-ferrous objects.  
• The MAC-51B Magnetic and Cable Locator can operate in both active and passive modes.  
	• It effectively locates cables unless adjacent objects interfere with the signal.  
• The invention introduces a system that enhances the ease of locating adjacent conductive objects.  
	• It uses a transmitter with two antennae to induce distinguishable alternating currents in the objects.  
• The method involves producing distinguishable currents and sensing their associated magnetic fields.  
	• This allows for an output signal that reflects the presence of both currents.  
• The system can produce distinct output signal nulls over each cable, improving tracing accuracy.  
	• It allows operators to identify and trace one or both cables more effectively than prior methods.  
• Various techniques can distinguish the currents, including different carrier frequencies and modulation methods.  
	• This ensures that the receiver only produces an output signal when both currents are detected.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides an apparatus for hands-free automatic answering and communication via a speaker phone connected to a telephone network.  
	• It includes a selector switch for automatic answering and a timer to control call duration.  
• The system is designed to assist individuals who may have difficulty using a traditional telephone, such as those with physical disabilities or those engaged in tasks that require both hands.  
	• It aims to offer a simplified, portable solution that can be easily connected to various telephone jacks.  
• Two embodiments of the interfacing apparatus are described: one electronic and one electromechanical, both featuring automatic call answering capabilities.  
	• Each embodiment includes mechanisms for timing and extending call duration as needed.  
• The detailed descriptions include circuit diagrams and component specifications for implementing the preferred embodiments.  
	• The components are designed to ensure safety, reliability, and cost-effectiveness while maximizing convenience.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on optical fiber communications and network design.  
    • It aims to incorporate branch powered amplification in undersea networks.  
    • The system enhances survivability against cable cuts.  
    • It utilizes a trunk and branch structure with a ring topology.  
• The system reduces the need for undersea optical repeaters.  
    • Remotely pumped optical amplifiers are used instead.  
    • Energy is supplied over the same branch cables that carry communication signals.  
    • This configuration maintains connectivity even during faults.  
• The architecture includes telecommunications hubs and branching units.  
    • Hubs serve as access points for routing communications.  
    • Branching units allow for adding or dropping signals conveniently.  
    • The system supports wavelength-division-multiplexing (WDM) technologies.  
• The optical amplifiers are powered by light energy from a remote source.  
    • The light source operates at a different wavelength than the communication signals.  
    • This setup eliminates the need for additional fiber runs for power.  
    • The system can be adapted for terrestrial applications as well.  
• The design allows for flexibility and scalability in network configurations.  
    • It can accommodate varying numbers of hubs and branches.  
    • Tunable branching units enable reconfiguration of signal paths.  
    • The system respects sovereignty concerns in undersea communications.  
• The invention aims to lower capital and operational costs.  
    • It reduces the number of required optical repeaters.  
    • Maintenance costs are minimized due to the repeaterless design.  
    • The technology is expected to evolve with advancements in optical components.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cover plate device for wiring devices in ganged boxes.
    * The device aims to prevent unwanted access and provide a finished look without visible fasteners.
    * It consists of two parts: an attachment member and a cover plate member.
    * The design accommodates uneven wall surfaces and allows for easy installation and removal.
    * The cover plate has no visible fasteners, enhancing safety and aesthetics.

* The prior art methods had exposed screws, which were unsightly and posed safety hazards.
    * Previous solutions, like U.S. Pat. No. 4,873,396, had limitations regarding screw installation depth.
    * The new design uses latching pawls and saw-tooth racks for secure attachment.
    * The cover plate can be adjusted to fit irregular wall contours.
    * The device can be adapted for various configurations, including multiple wiring devices.

* The preferred embodiments demonstrate the versatility of the cover plate device.
    * Different configurations are provided for one to four wiring devices.
    * Each configuration maintains the principle of no visible fasteners.
    * The installation process is consistent across different designs.
    * The invention allows for customization based on the number of wiring devices needed.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a collapsible light-shielding device for screens.
	* It aims to improve clarity by reducing reflections on displays like televisions and monitors.
* The known device has disadvantages, including the need for a special fastening device.
	* This results in increased costs and an unattractive appearance for the screen housing.
* The new design features concentric annular strips that can slide over one another.
	* This allows the device to be compact when not in use and easily adjustable when extended.
* The strips can be attached using Velcro and can accommodate various screen shapes.
	* They can be positioned to allow viewing from different angles without obstruction.
* The device includes hooks and locking elements for secure operation.
	* An adapter member provides a flat attachment face for compatibility with various monitors.
* The strips can be made from solid materials or bent plate materials.
	* They are designed to be inexpensive to produce while ensuring reliable functionality.
* The invention allows for modifications in design while maintaining the core concept of concentric nesting.
	* This flexibility enhances usability and adaptability to different viewing conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention addresses the challenge of speakers unintentionally speaking too quickly for listeners, particularly non-native speakers.
	* The solution involves a device that monitors speaking rates and notifies the speaker to slow down when their rate exceeds a threshold based on the listener's comprehension ability.
	* The device can utilize various sensory mechanisms (e.g., vibrations, sounds) to alert the speaker and can be integrated into wearable technology or telecommunication systems.

* The method includes determining the language of discourse, assessing listener proficiency, and adjusting speaking rates accordingly.
	* It involves profiling listeners to estimate their comprehension rates and can suggest alternative languages if both speaker and listener share proficiency in another language.
	* The system can also analyze speech clarity and emotional content to further refine the speaking rate threshold for better understanding.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a device for optical recording of rapid processes using a TV camera.  
		• It includes means for beam deviation and suppression to scan over N lines of a picture plane.  
		• Aimed at providing high-resolution recordings of fast-changing phenomena.  
• Conventional TV cameras operate at 25 Hz, limiting their ability to capture rapid events.  
		• High-speed cameras exist but are expensive and do not allow immediate analysis.  
		• The invention seeks to achieve higher picture sequence frequencies with simpler means.  
• The device features a cyclic line counter and a sawtooth generator for beam control.  
		• The counter counts line pulses and generates an end-of-count pulse for beam suppression.  
		• The sawtooth generator controls vertical beam deviation synchronized with the counter.  
• A programmable counter allows for flexible adjustment of the number of scanned lines (p).  
		• This enables the selection of different time resolutions while maintaining spatial resolution.  
		• The device can increase picture sequence frequency significantly compared to standard cameras.  
• The system can be modified to scan different lines in successive cycles for better data capture.  
		• This method allows for the filling of gaps in the recorded data for analysis.  
		• It is particularly useful for processes that require immediate digital evaluation.  
• The invention is applicable for recording various types of images, including IR, UV, or X-ray.  
		• It provides a cost-effective alternative to traditional film cameras for rapid process analysis.  
		• The device facilitates immediate computer-assisted interpretation of recorded images.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on multimedia communications, particularly for integrating multimedia calls with legacy phone systems.  
    • The telecommunications industry is rapidly evolving, with increasing consumer demand for multimedia services.  
    • Existing approaches often require costly upgrades to customer premises and network equipment.  
    • The invention aims to integrate multimedia capabilities into packet-switched calls without replacing existing hardware.  

• A blended call combines voice and multimedia functions into a single session.  
    • A multimedia server works in conjunction with a telephony server to manage these blended calls.  
    • The system determines if the recipient supports blended capabilities before routing the call.  
    • The call is processed through a "blender" software that manages both voice and multimedia components.  

• The invention is compatible with various network systems and protocols, particularly SIP.  
    • It allows for the use of existing network devices, prolonging their viability.  
    • The system can handle both incoming and outgoing calls with multimedia capabilities.  
    • It maintains control over signaling paths to accommodate multimedia requests during calls.  

• The methodology includes specific processes for handling incoming and outgoing calls.  
    • Incoming calls are routed to the appropriate server based on the recipient's capabilities.  
    • Outgoing calls initiate a multimedia session alongside the voice call.  
    • The system prevents infinite loops in call processing through loopback signals or indications.  
</summary>

<summary>
* Related Applications  
	* The invention is related to two concurrently filed applications on content synchronization and search methods.  

* Field of the Invention  
	* Focuses on electronic service delivery and content synchronization frameworks for connected devices.  

* Background  
	* Existing synchronization methods are limited by predefined attributes and lack flexibility in data handling.  

* Summary of the Invention  
	* Introduces a method for content synchronization that prioritizes file downloads based on context and dynamic attributes.  

* Synchronization Framework  
	* Comprises a central reference point server, client devices, and network connectivity for efficient data transfer.  

* Delta List Creation  
	* Clients create a delta list of files to download based on differences from local copies, optimizing the synchronization process.  

* Bundle Properties  
	* Bundles contain file descriptions, download priorities, and actions to be performed post-download, ensuring inter-file dependencies are maintained.  

* Communication Efficiency  
	* Employs data compression and caching to enhance performance over low bandwidth connections.  

* Adaptive Downloading  
	* The framework allows for adaptive downloading, resuming from the last successful synchronization point in case of failures.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides methods and systems for communication between finders and owners of lost objects.
	*  The system allows anonymous communication to protect owner privacy.
	*  It addresses issues with traditional methods of tagging possessions.
	*  The invention includes a unique ID system for tracking lost items.

* Owners can register their contact information with a unique ID.
	*  Tags can be physical labels or electronic tags like RFID.
	*  Owners can associate their ID with a virtual locale for communication.
	*  The system facilitates timely communication when an object is found.

* Finders can access a website to report found items.
	*  They can create an account to manage communications with owners.
	*  The system allows finders to send anonymous messages to owners.
	*  Finders can view open cases related to found items.

* The system includes a database for storing owner and finder information.
	*  It validates user credentials for secure access.
	*  Users can edit their account settings and tag information.
	*  The database supports the management of open communication cases.

* The invention incorporates various messaging protocols for notifications.
	*  It can send alerts via email and instant messaging platforms.
	*  The system ensures that real email addresses remain confidential.
	*  Users can receive messages through multiple channels.

* The process includes checks for valid IDs and user authentication.
	*  Subroutines are used to validate user sessions.
	*  The system handles incoming messages and forwards them appropriately.
	*  It generates anonymous email addresses for secure communication.

* The invention aims to reduce the risk of identity theft and loss of privacy.
	*  It provides a safer alternative to traditional tagging methods.
	*  The system is designed to be user-friendly for both owners and finders.
	*  It enhances the chances of returning lost items to their rightful owners.

* The technology can be implemented using various programming languages and platforms.
	*  Examples include Perl, Apache, and MySQL.
	*  Open-source modules can facilitate integration with messaging systems.
	*  The system is adaptable to different operating environments.
</summary>

<summary>
* Statement Regarding Federal Rights
    * Invention made with government support under Contract No. W-7405-ENG-36.
    * U.S. Department of Energy holds certain rights in the invention.
* Field of the Invention
    * Relates to electron multipliers, specifically for photomultipliers and particle detectors.
    * Includes channel electron multipliers and microchannel plates.
* Background of the Invention
    * Two conventional types of electron multipliers: discrete dynode and continuous electron multipliers.
    * Discrete dynode multipliers amplify electrons through a cascade effect.
* Foil Electron Multiplier Design
    * Utilizes thin, in-line foils to create secondary electrons.
    * Allows incident particles to continue to subsequent foils, enhancing electron avalanche.
* Advantages of Foil Electron Multiplier
    * Higher gain per multiplication stage, leading to increased efficiency.
    * Simpler and lower-cost fabrication compared to continuous multipliers.
* Performance Characteristics
    * Can cover larger areas and is more robust than traditional multipliers.
    * Exhibits intrinsic rejection of ion feedback at each stage.
* Summary of Invention
    * Apparatus designed for electron multiplication by transmission using foils.
    * Foils are contained within a supporting structure in an evacuated enclosure.
* Gain Calculation
    * Gain is modeled based on transmission probabilities and secondary electron yields.
    * Optimized by maximizing electron transmission, grid transmission, and secondary electron yield.
* Experimental Results
    * Demonstrated higher gain efficiency than conventional electron multipliers.
    * Results validate the theoretical models presented in the invention.
</summary>

<summary>
* This application claims priority from earlier U.S. Provisional Applications.
	* It is a continuation-in-part of a previous application.
	* The invention relates to a system for viewing motion pictures in 3D.
* The invention addresses the limitations of existing 3D viewing technologies.
	* Prior art includes various methods for creating 3D effects from 2D images.
	* The 3-D Phenomenoscope synchronizes lens filters with motion in films.
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope uses real-time signals for lens control.
	* It does not require alterations to the original motion picture.
	* The system calculates synchronization events to control lens darkening.
* The invention allows any motion picture to be viewed in 3D.
	* It works with various media formats, including film and digital.
	* The system enhances the viewing experience without additional effort from producers.
* The human eye's depth perception is fundamental to the invention.
	* The Pulfrich effect is utilized to create the 3D illusion.
	* The system processes images to enhance perceived depth.
* The preferred embodiment includes lightweight glasses with controllable lenses.
	* The glasses contain a digital sensor and a computer processor.
	* They can adjust lens states based on detected motion.
* The invention overcomes common issues with 3D motion pictures.
	* It eliminates the need for special filming or projection equipment.
	* Viewer discomfort from traditional 3D glasses is reduced.
* The system is adaptable for various viewing environments.
	* It can be used in theaters, on TVs, or computer monitors.
	* The technology is designed to be user-friendly and accessible.
* Future embodiments may incorporate advanced algorithms for motion detection.
	* The system can potentially enhance other visual effects in motion pictures.
	* It aims to provide a more immersive viewing experience.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using mechanical pressure instead of traditional saws.  
    • The process involves forming trenches along scribe lines on the wafer.  
    • Mechanical pressure is applied to achieve a "clean break" along these trenches, singulating individual die.  
    • This method addresses issues of speed, maintenance, and chipping associated with conventional dicing methods.  

• The detailed process includes several steps to prepare the wafer for singulation.  
    • A photo resist layer is applied and patterned to expose scribe lines.  
    • Trenches are etched into the wafer, with depths varying based on the final thickness desired.  
    • An adhesive tape is applied to the back surface before applying pressure for singulation.  

• The invention allows for flexibility in application across various types of semiconductor devices.  
    • It can be adapted for different wafer sizes and die types, including memory and logic chips.  
    • Alternative methods for forming trenches, such as partial cutting with a saw, are also considered.  
    • The invention aims to improve efficiency and yield in semiconductor manufacturing processes.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to field emission display (FED) devices.
	* * It includes a protection structure with reduction plates or electrodes to deflect ionic emissions away from field emission components.
	* * This design aims to prevent damage from electrical surges caused by ionized gases in the device.

* FED devices offer advantages over traditional liquid crystal displays (LCDs).
	* * They provide higher contrast ratios, larger viewing angles, and lower power consumption.
	* * FEDs generate their own light using colored phosphors, eliminating the need for backlighting.

* The structure of the FED includes a cathode, anode, and field emission elements.
	* * Electrons emitted from the cathode strike phosphors on the anode to produce images.
	* * The device operates under low pressure to maintain electron travel and prevent contamination.

* The protection structure can be designed in various configurations.
	* * Reduction plates can be arranged parallel to field emission elements or in a meshwork pattern.
	* * These configurations help to effectively redirect ionized gases away from the cathode.

* The manufacturing process for FED devices involves multiple steps.
	* * Techniques such as photolithography and etching are used to create the necessary layers and structures.
	* * The process aims to reduce costs and improve efficiency compared to traditional microtip FEDs.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an image sensor with multiple imaging planes.
	* * It aims to improve upon traditional CCD image sensors that only allow imaging from one surface.
	* * The design enables simultaneous imaging of opposing surfaces, reducing complexity and cost.
* Prior art includes CCD sensors that only capture images from a single plane.
	* * U.S. Pat. No. 4,031,315 describes a sensor that can be illuminated from either the top or bottom.
	* * U.S. Pat. No. 4,665,420 discusses a sensor that prevents charge carrier injection but is limited to single-plane imaging.
* The new image sensor features a semiconductor substrate with light-receptive edges.
	* * It includes charge collection and transfer means adjacent to the edges for effective imaging.
	* * The design allows for charge carriers generated by light to be guided toward collection areas.
* The sensor comprises an elongated P-type substrate with multiple imaging planes.
	* * It has imaging planes on the top surface and two edge surfaces.
	* * The structure includes highly doped and lightly doped layers to facilitate charge movement.
* P+ layers create a waveguide effect to guide charge carriers toward the center of the substrate.
	* * This design prevents charge loss and enhances the likelihood of signal collection.
	* * The effective horizontal aperture on the edges allows for continuous imaging without pixel separation.
* A second embodiment improves charge collection and reduces crosstalk.
	* * It extends N-type regions to the edges, increasing the depletion region's lateral extent.
	* * This modification enhances the overall performance of the image sensor.
* The image sensor can be utilized in various applications, including color imaging.
	* * It can scan documents in a single pass using color filters for red, green, and blue.
	* * The design is adaptable for different configurations and imaging needs.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to home networks with power management systems.  
    • The goal is to reduce energy consumption of network devices.  
    • Current devices consume significant power even when idle.  
    • Energy Star guidelines mandate low power consumption in idle states.  
• A network master node performs administrative functions and nominal device functions.  
    • It is challenging for the master node to enter power management while active.  
    • This leads to unnecessary energy use in home networks.  
    • A solution is needed to minimize power consumption while maintaining functionality.  
• The invention proposes methods for transferring administrative functions from master to slave devices.  
    • This allows the master node to enter a power management state.  
    • The slave node takes over the administrative functions.  
    • This transfer can occur while the slave node performs its own functions.  
• The network is structured as a master/slave configuration.  
    • Devices can serve as either master or slave nodes.  
    • Only one device can be the master at any time.  
    • The system includes various devices like video and audio servers.  
• The master node can enter power save mode based on network activity.  
    • It checks for traffic before transitioning to power save mode.  
    • If no traffic is detected, it enters power save mode directly.  
    • If traffic is present, it broadcasts a transfer request to slave nodes.  
• Slave nodes respond to transfer requests from the master node.  
    • They send a request reply indicating their willingness to accept the transfer.  
    • The master node selects the most qualified slave node for the transfer.  
    • The transfer includes necessary data for the slave to perform administrative functions.  
• Selection criteria for the new master node include visibility and capabilities.  
    • The master node evaluates the responses from slave nodes.  
    • It can select based on processing power or functional capabilities.  
    • User preferences can also influence the selection process.  
• The process ensures minimal disruption in network administration.  
    • The transfer of functions is designed to be quick and efficient.  
    • If no suitable slave node is available, a node may self-promote.  
    • The system is resilient to changes in network status.  
• The invention aims to optimize home network performance while conserving energy.  
    • It addresses the need for efficient power management in home networks.  
    • The methods enhance the overall functionality and reliability of the network.  
    • The approach is adaptable to

<summary>
• The invention pertains to antenna arrangements for measuring electromagnetic radiation direction.  
    • The focus is on determining the angle of arrival of signals.  
    • Challenges exist in measuring low elevation angles due to ground reflections.  
• Prior art includes a triplet arrangement from U.K. Patent No. 1449196.  
    • This arrangement allows for elevation angle measurement independent of ground reflection coefficients.  
    • The invention builds on this by optimizing angle measurements at low elevation angles.  
• The invention proposes an antenna array with at least four antennas.  
    • The array includes two equi-spaced linear triplets.  
    • It utilizes radio receiver means to process signals from the antennas.  
• Logic means are included to combine and derive signals from the triplet antennas.  
    • The first logic means combines signals from outer antennas.  
    • The second logic means derives a signal from the center antenna.  
• The derived signals are used to calculate a quotient signal.  
    • This quotient is a function of the elevation angle but not the ground reflection coefficient.  
    • Selection means provide a measure of the elevation angle from the quotient signals.  
• The array can operate in either receive or transmit mode.  
    • In receive mode, angle measurement is unambiguous.  
    • In transmit mode, signals must be coded for identification.  
• The design aims for unambiguous angle measurements up to 7 degrees.  
    • Measurement accuracy is targeted at +/-0.05 degrees.  
    • The configuration minimizes the number of antenna elements used.  
• The triplet arrangement is optimized for specific elevation angles.  
    • Values for spacing and height are calculated for maximum sensitivity.  
    • The system can monitor aircraft height during landing approaches.  
• The system can also be used for coding angles in space via radio transmissions.  
    • Each triplet can be energized with different modulation frequencies.  
    • The resulting quotients can be derived in a remote receiver for angle determination.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on high intensity, thermal efficient incandescent lamps, particularly subminiature lamps.  
    • The design aims to improve bulb life and user safety.  
    • It addresses issues related to adhesive degradation in conventional lamps.  
• Conventional subminiature lamps use adhesives to bond glass envelopes to metal sleeves.  
    • Adhesives break down due to thermal cycling and cleaning processes.  
    • Moisture can penetrate adhesive cracks, leading to electrical failures.  
• The proposed solution involves a polymeric seal support around the glass envelope.  
    • The polymer provides a liquid-tight seal and enhances thermal resistance.  
    • Fluoroelastomers are preferred for their chemical resistance and high-temperature stability.  
• The polymeric seal support eliminates the need for adhesives.  
    • This allows for better centering of the glass envelope within the base.  
    • It also reduces the risk of off-center conditions that can lead to failures.  
• The design includes a potting material to stabilize electrical leads and minimize gas penetration.  
    • This material can be silicone or epoxy, providing additional protection.  
    • It helps maintain the integrity of the lamp during thermal cycling.  
• The assembly process involves close tolerances and the use of instant adhesives for bonding.  
    • The abbreviated height conductive base is designed for easy assembly.  
    • The potting material is injected to fill gaps and enhance sealing.  
• The invention is applicable beyond medical uses to any high-heat, chemically resistant applications.  
    • It aims to improve insulation and sealing in various environments.  
    • The techniques can be adapted for different lamp designs and uses.  
• The invention allows for modifications and improvements without departing from its core principles.  
    • It encourages innovation in lamp design and manufacturing.  
    • The focus remains on enhancing performance and reliability.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to MIMO communication systems, focusing on precoder configuration.
	• • It addresses the computational challenges of Generalized Decision Feedback Equalizer (GDFE) precoders.
	• • The goal is to optimize system capacity in MU-MIMO wireless systems.

• Various precoding techniques are discussed, including Block Diagonalization (BD) and Tomlinson-Harashima Precoding (THP).
	• • BD separates data streams but limits system capacity.
	• • THP offers higher capacity but is more complex.

• The GDFE precoder achieves high system capacity but has prohibitive computational costs.
	• • It includes an interference pre-cancellation block to manage symbol interference.
	• • The design traditionally requires knowledge of the covariance matrix, increasing complexity.

• The proposed method reduces computational costs without sacrificing capacity.
	• • It relaxes the need for the covariance matrix associated with "Least Favorable Noise."
	• • The method is applicable to future 4G cellular networks.

• The invention includes a method for configuring the GDFE precoder in a base station.
	• • It involves computing filter matrices for effective signal processing.
	• • The configuration aims to enhance performance in practical MU-MIMO systems.

• Numerical examples illustrate the computation of matrices involved in the GDFE precoder design.
	• • Examples demonstrate scenarios with known and unknown noise covariance matrices.
	• • Results show the effectiveness of the proposed methods in various configurations.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to a heat-dissipating device and its housing.  
    • The focus is on an axial fan that increases airflow without altering assembly conditions.  
    • The design aims to enhance the fan's heat-dissipating performance.  
    • The housing design allows for improved airflow intake.  

• Conventional fans have limitations due to their housing design.  
    • The rectangular shape restricts airflow passage dimensions.  
    • Air intake is primarily axial, limiting airflow rate improvements.  
    • The design wastes space and materials in the fan housing.  

• The invention proposes an outward extension of the housing sidewall.  
    • This extension enlarges the intake airflow area.  
    • The impeller's dimensions can also be increased.  
    • The overall heat-dissipating efficiency is enhanced.  

• The air passage design features a gradually reducing cross-sectional area.  
    • This design concentrates airflow towards the center.  
    • It targets the hottest part of the heat sink for effective cooling.  
    • The airflow is optimized for better heat dissipation.  

• The housing includes an outer frame with specific air passage designs.  
    • The sidewall can extend radially outward in various shapes.  
    • Inclined portions can be added to reduce noise and turbulence.  
    • The assembly remains compatible with existing systems.  

• The heat-dissipating device can be integrated with a heat sink.  
    • It is designed to mount onto electrical components like CPUs.  
    • The device enhances cooling by directing airflow effectively.  
    • The assembly ensures efficient heat transfer from the CPU.  

• The invention allows for various modifications and adaptations.  
    • It is not limited to the preferred embodiments described.  
    • The scope of the invention is broad to encompass different designs.  
    • Future modifications can enhance the device's performance further.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel.
    * It can display images in different colors based on usage situations.
    * The panel is particularly suitable for automobile instrument panels.
    * It aims to eliminate the need for an intermediate electrode, simplifying the structure.
    * The display can show green light at night and lemon light during the day.

* The display panel consists of multiple layers on a glass substrate.
    * It includes first and second electrode layers arranged in a matrix.
    * The first luminescent layer emits light without red components, while the second includes red components.
    * The overlapping layers create single and double layer portions for color variation.
    * The design allows for selective color display by adjusting voltage levels.

* The panel's operation is optimized for different lighting conditions.
    * Green light is emitted at low voltage for night use.
    * Lemon light, a mix of green and orange, is emitted at higher voltages for daytime.
    * The structure is designed to be cost-effective and simple.
    * Color purity can be adjusted by changing the width of the luminescent layers.

* Various embodiments of the display panel are described.
    * The second embodiment features square double layer portions for improved viewer comfort.
    * The third embodiment includes a red color filter to modify emitted colors.
    * The fourth embodiment eliminates the second luminescent layer, relying solely on color filters.
    * The fifth embodiment incorporates thicker portions on the first luminescent layer for enhanced luminance.

* The materials and configurations can be modified for different applications.
    * Alternative luminescent materials can be used in the layers.
    * The design allows for flexibility in electrode shapes for pattern displays.
    * Additional features like black pigment coatings can enhance display quality.
    * The invention is adaptable to various technological advancements in display technology.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony.
    • It enables low-cost telephony by converting speech into digital data packets for transmission over the Internet.
    • The terminal supports wireless communication, allowing flexibility and mobility without the need for specialized equipment.
    • It can dynamically allocate IP addresses, facilitating user connectivity regardless of location.

• The system includes a service server that connects multiple users and manages communication.
    • Users can access additional services like news, emails, and chat functionalities based on their profiles.
    • The server tracks user availability and IP addresses to establish connections between users.
    • Speech recognition features may be integrated to simplify terminal operation and enhance user experience.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention addresses the challenges of integrating high-dielectric constant oxides, particularly Pb/Bi-containing materials, with semiconductor substrates like silicon and gallium arsenide.
		• A germanium buffer layer is proposed to minimize the formation of low dielectric constant layers and enhance epitaxial growth.
		• A stable non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide layer can be used as a buffer to prevent diffusion of reactive elements into the substrate.

• The method involves growing a buffer layer on a semiconductor substrate followed by depositing a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide.
		• The preferred buffer layer is a thin layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide, such as barium strontium titanate.
		• This structure can be utilized in various semiconductor applications, including non-volatile memory cells and capacitors.
</summary>

<summary>
* Receiver input circuits utilize preamplifiers and mixers with adjustable selection means.
	* * Aim to balance small and large signal behavior with low production costs.
	* * Limited dynamic characteristics of semiconductor components lead to signal distortion issues.

* Previous Siemens publications describe various circuit arrangements for TV and FM receivers.
	* * Amplification control is achieved using PIN diode control networks.
	* * Control signals are derived from the intermediate frequency (IF) section to prevent overloading.

* The invention aims to eliminate undesired signal actuation of non-linear components.
	* * Introduces multiple amplification control loops for better signal management.
	* * Each control loop has different response thresholds and bandwidths.

* The first amplification control circuit prevents overloading of the mixer stage and varactor diodes.
	* * It operates within the transmission bandwidth of the selective network.
	* * Ensures no relaxation oscillations occur during modulation.

* The second amplification control circuit addresses overloading from powerful signals.
	* * It has a narrower bandwidth than the first control circuit.
	* * Designed to respond to lower signal levels to protect the mixer stage.

* The third amplification control circuit supports the other circuits with lower thresholds.
	* * It can be adjusted based on the control signal from the second circuit.
	* * Helps reduce amplification in the presence of spurious signals.

* Various embodiments of the input circuit are presented, showcasing different configurations.
	* * Includes tunable networks and iterations for alignment of tuning circuits.
	* * Emphasizes the use of PIN diodes for effective control and minimal distortion.
</summary>

<summary>
* Invention Overview
	* Aims to create a collaborative work-sharing environment for distant individuals.
	* Focuses on simplifying the setup process for collaborative sessions.
	* Utilizes existing telephone infrastructure for voice communication.

* Background of Collaborative Technologies
	* Traditional video conferencing systems are costly and require dedicated spaces.
	* PC-based solutions are more affordable but often complex for non-technical users.
	* Current systems necessitate cumbersome setup processes, often requiring separate phone calls for coordination.

* Proposed System Features
	* Each telephone has a collaboration button and an indicator for collaboration capability.
	* The system allows users to initiate collaboration without interrupting voice calls.
	* Collaboration applications can be launched automatically upon button activation.

* Technical Implementation
	* The system connects telephones and PCs over a Local Area Network (LAN).
	* Collaboration control programs manage communication between devices and applications.
	* The architecture supports both direct LAN connections and Internet-based communications.

* Variations and Alternatives
	* The invention can be adapted for multiparty collaboration and different network architectures.
	* Integration of telephone functions within PCs is possible, allowing for flexible setups.
	* The system can be implemented as a computer program on various carrier mediums.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on optimizing the insertion of advertising clips into video sequences.
	* * It aims to enhance the visual impact of ads by ensuring continuity between the video content and the ads.
	* * The method involves generating salience maps for both the video sequence and the advertising clips to determine similarity.

* Microsoft™'s VideoSense tool is referenced as a prior art example.
	* * VideoSense selects and inserts ads based on low-level parameters like color and movement.
	* * However, it neglects the temporal extension of viewer fixation after shot changes, which can reduce ad effectiveness.

* The proposed method includes steps for generating salience maps and calculating degrees of similarity.
	* * Salience maps represent areas of interest in both the video and the ads.
	* * The method selects the ad with the highest similarity to the video sequence's salience map for insertion.

* A device is also described for implementing this method.
	* * The device includes components for processing, memory, and input/output interfaces.
	* * It can detect shot changes and insert ads at optimal points in the video sequence.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention introduces a recessed mask structure to mitigate high electrical fields in sub 250 nanometer semiconductor devices.  
		• This structure aims to reduce leakage and breakdown at material interfaces.  
		• It is particularly beneficial for high-speed and high-density integrated circuits.  
• The recessed mask is positioned below the surface to be planarized, enhancing the integrity of the dielectric and conductive layers.  
		• The mask is placed 0.5 to 20 nanometers below the surface, with 5 nanometers being preferred.  
		• This positioning helps avoid high electric field concentrations that can lead to device failures.  
• The process allows for a lower overall capacitance, improving signal propagation in interconnect wiring.  
		• The mask material is selected to minimize its dielectric constant impact on the device.  
		• The invention enables better control over the processing of materials with varying properties.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on designing radio receivers using digital signal processing (DSP) techniques.
	* It addresses challenges in converting analog signals to digital for improved performance.
	* The design aims to eliminate complexities associated with conventional analog circuitry.
* The Downconverting Digitizer converts modulated intermediate frequency (IF) signals to digital representations.
	* It downconverts signals to baseband in-phase (I) and quadrature (Q) components.
	* The design incorporates automatic gain control (AGC) to enhance dynamic range and minimize quantization noise.
* The predictive loop is central to the invention, allowing for efficient signal prediction and error minimization.
	* It utilizes DSP techniques to implement the predictive filter, enhancing flexibility and performance.
	* The loop structure enables dynamic adjustment of filter characteristics based on input signal properties.
* The invention includes an offset nulling mechanism to dynamically remove offsets during conversion.
	* This feature improves the accuracy of the analog-to-digital conversion process.
	* It eliminates the need for manual calibration, addressing performance degradation issues.
* The digital quadrature mixer simplifies the downconversion process to baseband.
	* It leverages specific frequency selections to reduce implementation complexity.
	* The design allows for efficient routing of output samples to generate I and Q components.
* Implementation examples demonstrate the effectiveness of the Downconverting Digitizer in real-world applications.
	* The design achieved over 52 dB of dynamic range, comparable to dual 8-bit converters.
	* The AGC loop further extends the dynamic range to over 124 dB, showcasing its performance capabilities.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on a method and apparatus for creating sensors with nanodimensional features for detecting molecular compounds and organisms.
    * Utilizes nanowires and nanotubes for high-sensitivity detection of biomolecule binding.
    * Employs nanoimprint lithography (NIL) to fabricate arrays of semiconductor nanotraces for multiplex detection.
    * Aims to provide a cost-effective and reproducible method for sensor fabrication.
    * Incorporates techniques for binding probe molecules to enhance detection capabilities.

* The fabrication process involves multiple steps, including the creation of a multiplex detection array and the synthesis of anchor probe libraries.
    * Begins with the deposition of gate and source/drain electrodes on a substrate.
    * Semiconductor active layers are patterned into nanotraces using NIL.
    * A microfluidic cover plate is used for the controlled deposition of sensitizing compounds.
    * The final device is packaged for electrical monitoring and signal processing.

* The sensors are designed to detect target molecules through changes in electrical conductivity.
    * Each sensor device is independently addressable and can respond to specific targets.
    * The binding of target molecules to anchored probes results in measurable current changes.
    * The system allows for simultaneous detection of multiple analytes.
    * Results can be processed and displayed for diagnostic purposes.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention introduces a method for singulating and plating semiconductor packages, focusing on plating the side surfaces of leadframe connectors to prevent contamination.
	• The method includes steps such as providing semiconductor dies on a leadframe, singulating the dies, and plating the exposed side surfaces with a different material than the leads.

• Various embodiments of the method involve different cutting techniques, including full and partial cuts, and the use of blades with varying thicknesses and bevels.
	• The plating materials can include metals like tin, silver, gold, and nickel-based alloys, which are chosen for their resistance to oxidation.

• The resulting semiconductor packages feature plated top and side surfaces, enhancing solderability and reducing the risk of oxide formation during assembly onto printed circuit boards.
	• The designs of the packages can vary, including different side surface shapes and heights achieved through the cutting process.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a dual mode mobile terminal.
	* * It focuses on a method for selectively connecting to wireless wide area networks (WWAN) and wireless local networks (WLAN).
* Fixed Mobile Convergence (FMC) integrates WWAN and WLAN for seamless communication.
	* * The mobile terminal can switch between networks based on signal strength thresholds.
* Power consumption is a concern when both GSM and WiFi modules are active simultaneously.
	* * The invention proposes turning off the GSM module when connected to WLAN and activating it when WLAN signal drops.
* The mobile terminal receives service information from the WLAN to expedite WWAN connection.
	* * This information includes signal strength, channel data, and base station identity codes.
* The mobile terminal can skip initial scanning procedures using the service information.
	* * If connection fails, it will perform a conventional scanning process.
* The method allows for continuous operation regardless of the mobile terminal's status (e.g., call setup, idle).
	* * It ensures a smooth transition between WLAN and WWAN for ongoing communication.
</summary>

<summary>
* Overview of the Invention
	* * The invention simplifies the production of multilayered electrical components.
	* * It focuses on a new process and apparatus for manufacturing capacitors.
	* * The products created by this process are also part of the invention.

* Conventional Manufacturing Steps
	* * Traditional methods involve multiple steps including casting, printing, stacking, and cutting.
	* * Thermal processing is required to eliminate organic components and fire the structure.
	* * Testing for electrical parameters is essential to ensure quality.

* Key Parameters for Capacitance
	* * Capacitance is influenced by dielectric thickness, dielectric constant, active area, and number of layers.
	* * Accurate control of these parameters is crucial for achieving desired capacitance values.
	* * Variations in manufacturing can lead to defects like delaminations.

* Major Objectives of the New Process
	* * The new process aims to eliminate costly steps in traditional manufacturing.
	* * It allows for the creation of multiple laminate sub-assemblies efficiently.
	* * The process can produce capacitors, coils, and resistances with high production rates.

* Steps in the New Process
	* * The process includes providing electrodes and components, followed by stacking sub-assemblies.
	* * Decals are used for precise registration and manipulation of components.
	* * The method allows for curing and stacking without the need for cutting.

* Advantages of the New Process
	* * Smaller parts can be fabricated with lower voltage ratings.
	* * There are no shape limitations, allowing for diverse configurations.
	* * Enhanced in-process inspection reduces the risk of defects.

* Elimination of Cutting Operation
	* * The new method avoids cutting, which can cause micro cracks and defects.
	* * This leads to more reliable parts suitable for high-reliability applications.
	* * The process reduces labor content and capital investment.

* Applications Beyond Capacitors
	* * The method is adaptable for multilayer ferrite inductors and other electronic devices.
	* * It can be used for creating multilayer substrates with buried metal circuitry.
	* * Potential applications include semiconductor packages and precision resistors.

* Coil Production Method
	* * The process includes forming multiple laminates with conductive and non-conductive materials.
	* * Stacking these laminates allows for electrical interconnection to form coils.
	* * This method eliminates the need for traditional winding of coils.

* Future Possibilities
	* * The invention opens avenues

<summary>
• The application claims benefit from a prior U.S. Provisional Application.
	• The prior application is related to cellular lattice structures.
	• It was filed on March 20, 2008.
	• The entire disclosure is incorporated by reference.

• The invention was developed with U.S. Government support.
	• It was funded by the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency.
	• The grant number is N00014-07-1-0114.
	• The government retains certain rights in the invention.

• The invention pertains to cellular materials for structural applications.
	• It focuses on hierarchical cellular lattices.
	• The materials have various applications in transportation and construction.
	• The structures can be integrated with adjacent components.

• The invention includes a sandwich panel core with a lattice structure.
	• The lattice utilizes hierarchical trusses for support.
	• The design maintains low weight while providing high stiffness and strength.
	• Applications include ballistic protection and thermal transfer.

• The hierarchical structure consists of multiple orders of cells.
	• Cells are categorized by size, with first order being the largest.
	• The structure allows for nesting and mating of different cell orders.
	• This configuration enhances the overall strength and functionality.

• Various methods for manufacturing the lattice structures are described.
	• Techniques include injection molding and investment casting.
	• Materials can vary, including metals, polymers, and ceramics.
	• The manufacturing process can create hollow or solid structures.

• The lattice structures can be used in a wide range of applications.
	• They are suitable for use in vehicles, armor, and construction materials.
	• The structures can mitigate blast impacts and improve heat exchange.
	• They can also support catalysts and energy storage systems.

• The invention emphasizes the versatility of the lattice design.
	• It can be adapted for different shapes and configurations.
	• The structures can be curved or used in complex geometries.
	• Face sheets can be applied to enhance structural integrity.

• The application includes references to related patents and scientific articles.
	• Various methods and systems are incorporated by reference.
	• The scope of the invention is not limited to the specific embodiments described.
	• Modifications and variations are encouraged within the claims.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention describes a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons using Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) technology.  
    • The process integrates wet and dry gasification stages to optimize the production of synthesis gas and combustion gas.  
    • The wet gasification stage produces combustion gas at high pressures, while the dry gasification stage generates synthesis gas precursor suitable for hydrocarbon synthesis.  
    • The process aims to enhance economic and environmental benefits compared to conventional coal-fired power plants.  

• The process includes multiple stages for gasification, power generation, and hydrocarbon synthesis.  
    • Key stages include gas clean-up, Fischer-Tropsch synthesis, and CO2 removal, ensuring efficient conversion of coal to hydrocarbons.  
    • Hydrogen enrichment and power generation are achieved through various methods, including water gas shift conversion and gas turbine expansion.  
    • The integration of CTL (coal-to-liquid) and IGCC facilities allows for shared resources, improving overall efficiency and reducing costs.  

• The Fischer-Tropsch synthesis stages convert synthesis gas into valuable hydrocarbon products.  
    • The process utilizes different reactor types and conditions to optimize hydrocarbon yield and quality.  
    • Reaction water produced during synthesis is treated and recycled, contributing to water management in the facility.  
    • The hydrocarbon products are further processed to produce fuels like LPG, naphtha, and diesel.  

• CO2 management is a critical aspect of the process, focusing on capture and sequestration.  
    • CO2 produced during the process is directed to the IGCC facility for compression and potential sequestration.  
    • The integration allows for a relatively pure CO2 stream, minimizing nitrogen emissions from the combustion process.  
    • This approach enhances the overall carbon efficiency of the integrated facilities, supporting environmental sustainability.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention presents a method for preparing a solid oxide superconducting device with improved surface properties.
	* The method involves applying a blocking or passivation film to prevent oxygen loss from the surface, ensuring superconductivity is maintained.
	* Various materials, including silicon nitride and aluminum, can be used for the film, which is formed using techniques like photo-CVD and heat treatment.

* The invention addresses the issue of oxygen deficiency at the surface of oxide superconducting materials, enhancing their reliability.
	* By controlling the oxygen concentration through methods such as ion injection and heat treatment, the superconducting characteristics can be preserved.
	* The resulting devices, particularly Josephson elements, exhibit long-term stability and high reliability due to the effective passivation of the surface.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination.  
    • The apparatus allows for precise cutting of foam samples without damaging their delicate cell structure.  
• The design includes a stabilization base, clamping mechanism, and a screw thread specimen advance for uniform sample thickness.  
    • This ensures that samples can be cut with parallel edges for accurate microscopic analysis.  
• The method preserves the integrity of the foam's cell structure, facilitating detailed examination of physical properties.  
    • This aids in comparing different foam materials based on their performance criteria and characteristics.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to seismometers, particularly ocean bottom seismometers (OBS).
	* It focuses on determining the angle of inclination and leveling seismic motion detectors.
* OBS are crucial for geological research and oil/natural gas exploration.
	* They face unique challenges when deployed on the ocean floor compared to land seismometers.
* The invention provides a method to determine the angle of inclination of a seismometer.
	* This information aids in understanding the ocean floor's contour and improving data evaluation.
* The invention includes a self-leveling mechanism for seismic motion detectors.
	* It ensures proper alignment of detectors for accurate seismic motion sensing.
* A novel apparatus is described that uses a pendulum mechanism for leveling.
	* This mechanism is simpler and more cost-effective than previous methods like gimbals.
* The apparatus locks the detector's position for later measurement of the angle of inclination.
	* It enhances seismic wave coupling to improve data recording quality.
* The design includes a solenoid-operated plunger to secure the detector in place.
	* This allows for easy activation and ensures the detector remains stable during operation.
* The invention is adaptable for various types of seismic motion detectors.
	* It can accommodate both vertical and horizontal detectors based on operational needs.
* The overall goal is to improve the performance and reliability of seismometers on the ocean floor.
	* This contributes to more effective geological investigations and data collection.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention presents a novel humidity sensing element that overcomes limitations of traditional sensors.
    • The element is energized by low voltage currents and does not rely on mechanical movements.
    • It is physically robust, non-hygroscopic, and has a rapid response time of about one second.
    • The design includes a first conductive electrode, a porous dielectric coating, and a second conductive electrode.

• The manufacturing method involves specific steps to ensure effective humidity sensing.
    • The first electrode is anodized aluminum, with nickel particles deposited in the dielectric's porosity.
    • The second electrode is formed through vacuum deposition, ensuring moisture permeability.
    • The process includes hydrolizing and sealing the anodized layer to enhance performance.

• The sensor's impedance varies linearly with relative humidity, making it suitable for various applications.
    • It combines capacitive and resistive properties to achieve a linear response to humidity changes.
    • The sensor operates effectively within a temperature range typical for textile mills.
    • Optimal performance is achieved when excited by a 10 Hertz alternating current voltage.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a motor assembly with a force transmission structure.
    * It claims priority from a previous patent application in China.
    * The assembly is designed for vehicle window lift systems.
    * It aims to improve the transmission of motor rotation to the lift device.
    * The design addresses issues of vibration and noise in conventional systems.

* The force transmission structure features a drive plate and a shaft.
    * The drive plate has a Y-shaped mounting hole with at least three sections.
    * The shaft includes a toothed portion that fits into the mounting hole.
    * The design allows for stable rotation and reduced noise during operation.
    * The drive plate is preferably made of a plastics material for strength and impact resistance.

* The motor assembly includes a gear train connecting the motor to the drive plate.
    * The gear train consists of a worm, worm gear, and a damper.
    * The damper is made of rubber and helps in the transmission of motion.
    * The assembly is designed to drive a pinion that operates the window lift mechanism.
    * A circlip is used to secure the shaft within the mounting hole.

* The invention provides advantages over traditional designs.
    * It reduces the impact forces and vibrations during operation.
    * The increased contact area between components allows for greater torque handling.
    * Buffer holes in the drive plate aid in manufacturing and reduce distortion.
    * The overall design enhances the quiet operation of the window lift system.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to wireless communication systems, specifically for WCDMA systems.
    • The focus is on detecting, identifying, and monitoring multipath signals.
    • It addresses the challenges posed by the increasing complexity of mobile communication.
    • The goal is to enhance data transmission speeds and service capabilities in 3G systems.
    
• The system includes a mobile time reference generator for portable transceivers.
    • It comprises an antenna, radio frequency subsystem, and baseband subsystem.
    • The system utilizes both high and low frequency oscillators.
    • The mobile time reference operates in wake and sleep modes for power efficiency.

• The free running counter (FRC) generates the mobile time reference.
    • It uses a high frequency clock (30.72 MHz) and a low frequency clock (32 KHz).
    • The FRC maintains accuracy during idle modes to conserve power.
    • It updates the mobile time reference based on clock drift estimates.

• The WCDMA modem processes signals for multipath monitoring and recovery.
    • It includes components like primary sync searcher and multipath radio signal recovery circuit.
    • The system performs matched filtering and energy measurements for signal detection.
    • It allows for efficient recovery of transmitted code groups and frame timing.

• The invention improves power consumption and battery life in portable devices.
    • It enables quick transitions between active and idle modes.
    • The mobile time reference is maintained with high accuracy (32 nanoseconds).
    • This efficiency is crucial for detecting and processing incoming multipath signals.

• The method for generating a mobile time reference is detailed.
    • It involves providing high and low frequency clocks and generating the reference.
    • The reference is maintained during low frequency clock operation.
    • The system updates the reference when the high frequency clock becomes available.

• The invention encompasses various modifications and alternatives.
    • It aims to cover all potential changes within the scope of the claims.
    • The focus remains on enhancing wireless communication capabilities.
    • The technology is adaptable to future developments in mobile communication systems.
</summary>

<summary>
* Protective helmets with resilient liners are designed to absorb shock.
	* Previous methods for custom fitting have limitations, such as complexity and inability to adjust after fitting.
* A new helmet liner design allows for rapid and simple fitting to the wearer's head.
	* The liner can be refitted for different head sizes without the need for trimming.
* The liner consists of multiple layers of elastic thermoplastic sheets with open pockets.
	* This design enhances compliance and minimizes shifting on the wearer's head.
* The manufacturing process is simplified as layers do not need to be aligned precisely.
	* Open pockets allow for deformation without requiring drawstrings for tension.
* The liner is heated to a plastic state for fitting and then cooled to retain shape.
	* This process accommodates changes in head size due to hair or other factors.
* The helmet includes an outer shell made of reinforced plastic and an energy-absorbing foam liner.
	* The inner thermoplastic liner is secured to the shell using fasteners.
* The liner is designed to maintain consistent dimensions within a quarter-inch tolerance.
	* Six basic sizes are produced to fit a range of head sizes.
* The materials used for the liner include ethylene-vinyl acetate and ionomer resins.
	* These materials provide the necessary elasticity and durability for the helmet.
* The invention aims to improve comfort, fit, and manufacturing efficiency in helmet design.
	* It allows for repeated adjustments without compromising structural integrity.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to a multiorifice structure for fuel injection.
    • The structure is designed to atomize fuel in internal combustion engines.
    • It addresses the challenges of manufacturing small apertures economically.
    • The invention improves upon existing methods by providing angularly disposed passages.
    • The structure is made by fusing layers of rods and cylindrical members.

• The method of fabrication involves concentric layers of rods.
    • Each layer is disposed at progressively larger angles to enhance fluid dispersion.
    • The resulting triangular orifices improve atomization compared to circular ones.
    • The uniformity of the apertures is achieved through precise manufacturing techniques.
    • The final structure can be sliced to produce multiple multiorifice wafers.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method for manufacturing a semiconductor device, specifically an insulated gate (MOS) field effect device with a lightly doped drain (LDD) structure.
	* The method aims to improve the controllability of the oxide portion on the gate sidewall and allows for low-temperature processing.
* Conventional methods face challenges such as difficulty in determining etching time and issues with hot carrier injection leading to increased resistance and degraded transconductance.
	* These problems hinder the minimization of device size and performance.
* The proposed method includes forming an insulating film on the gate electrode and using it as a mask for ion injection, followed by anisotropic etching to control the width of the conductive layer on the gate sidewall.
	* This approach enhances the precision of the manufacturing process and prevents the etching away of the source/drain regions.
* Various embodiments of the invention are described, including the use of high melting point metals or silicides to improve device performance and reduce transconductance degradation.
	* The methods also allow for the formation of LDD structures with silicided regions, enhancing the electrical characteristics of the semiconductor device.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved end-user interface for Internet telephony.
	* * Internet telephony is a cost-effective alternative to conventional telephony.
	* * Current systems suffer from poor quality of service but are expected to improve.
	* * Existing IP telephones require high-performance PCs and additional sound equipment.

* The invention introduces an enhanced radio telephone for improved IP telephony.
	* * It can operate as both a conventional radio telephone and an IP telephone.
	* * The internal speech coder allows use with low-performance PCs.
	* * It reduces speech delay and echo problems common in current systems.

* The enhanced radio telephone connects to a PC via various methods.
	* * Connections can be made through serial, parallel, infrared, or short-range radio.
	* * It allows for control of IP-telephone functions from either the PC or the handset.
	* * Users can initiate calls using either the PC application or the handset keypad.

* Alternative embodiments include systems with integrated network interfaces.
	* * These systems can communicate directly with networks without needing a PC.
	* * They can handle both voice and data communication efficiently.
	* * The RF transceiver can adapt to different communication systems.

* The invention aims to provide a more convenient and economical IP telephone solution.
	* * It eliminates the need for high-end computers and additional accessories.
	* * The design focuses on user comfort and reduced echo during calls.
	* * It streamlines the telephony application for better performance.

* The scope of the invention is defined by the appended claims.
	* * Numerous equivalent embodiments are contemplated beyond the described examples.
	* * The invention is adaptable to various cost and performance requirements.
	* * It aims to enhance the overall user experience in Internet telephony.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on wave energy converters that utilize submerged devices to harness energy from surface waves.
	* * These devices operate by capturing hydrostatic pressure differences and wave-induced movements to produce useful work.
* Current wave energy technology is less developed compared to wind energy, despite the higher energy density of ocean waves.
	* * Many existing ocean wave energy converters (OWECs) are inefficient and costly due to heavy construction and low energy capture rates.
* The invention addresses limitations of prior art by using gas-filled containers that can expand and contract in response to wave pressure changes.
	* * It enhances energy capture through techniques like atmospheric venting and the use of floating bodies to increase stroke length.
* The design allows for adjustable depth deployment, improving efficiency and survivability in varying sea states.
	* * This adaptability is crucial for optimizing energy capture and protecting the device from severe conditions.
* The invention distinguishes itself from prior art by its lightweight construction, flexible components, and innovative energy capture methods.
	* * These features lead to higher efficiency and lower costs compared to existing wave energy technologies.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to scraped surface heat exchangers.  
    • The focus is on mounting blades to the central drive shaft.  
    • These heat exchangers are commonly used in food processing.  
    • They consist of a cylindrical outer tube with a central drive shaft.  
• Blades are used to mix and scrape material within the heat exchanger.  
    • Blades are typically flat and rectangular with a scraping edge.  
    • They are connected to the drive shaft via pins.  
    • Each blade has two pin receiving holes for secure attachment.  
• Installation of blades occurs when the drive shaft is removed from the outer tube.  
    • Blades must remain at a shallow angle during installation.  
    • This prevents them from swinging out and falling during the process.  
    • The installation can be cumbersome, especially in vertical configurations.  
• The invention proposes a new method for mounting blades.  
    • It utilizes L-shaped locking tracks on both sides of the blade.  
    • These tracks allow for pivotal connection while preventing lateral movement.  
    • The design ensures blades stay in place during installation.  
• The locking mechanism enhances the ease of installation.  
    • It prevents blades from falling off the pins during vertical installation.  
    • The design allows for correct orientation of the blades.  
    • It also reduces wear on the blades and pins over time.  
• The invention includes various embodiments and methods.  
    • Each embodiment aims to improve the mounting process.  
    • The claims cover all features and advantages of the invention.  
    • Modifications and variations are encouraged within the scope of the invention.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention addresses issues in cigarette production and packaging.
    * Focuses on detecting and eliminating defective or incorrectly positioned cigarettes.
    * Aims to prevent disruptions in the cigarette magazine of machines.
    * Traditional manual removal is labor-intensive and prone to human error.
    * The invention seeks to automate this process for efficiency.

* The detection process utilizes optical checking elements.
    * At least one camera captures images of cigarettes in the magazine.
    * An image-processing device evaluates these images against reference values.
    * Deviations from the reference trigger an error signal.
    * This allows for the identification of transversely located or defective cigarettes.

* The elimination process involves ejecting defective cigarettes.
    * Ejecting units are activated based on detection results.
    * Affected cigarettes are ejected from designated ejecting zones.
    * Multiple ejecting units can work together to remove transversely located cigarettes.
    * This minimizes waste by ensuring only necessary cigarettes are ejected.

* The design of the ejecting units prevents jamming.
    * The front and rear walls of the ejecting unit differ in size.
    * This design allows for smooth operation without partial grips.
    * Ejecting units can be actuated manually or automatically.
    * The system can also be used for sampling purposes.

* The system includes multiple evaluation and ejecting zones.
    * Each zone corresponds to specific ejecting units.
    * Cameras monitor these zones for defective cigarettes.
    * Time delays are implemented to account for cigarette movement.
    * This ensures timely ejection of detected defects.

* The camera setup enhances detection reliability.
    * Two cameras are positioned on the front and rear of the magazine.
    * This dual setup improves the identification of incorrectly positioned cigarettes.
    * The cameras provide a comprehensive view of the cigarette ends.
    * Transparent walls facilitate unobstructed monitoring.

* The invention aims to reduce operational costs.
    * Automating detection and ejection minimizes machine downtime.
    * Reduces the need for manual intervention by operators.
    * Enhances overall efficiency in cigarette production.
    * Contributes to better quality control in the manufacturing process.

* The system is adaptable for various operational needs.
    * Can be triggered manually for undetected errors.
    * Allows for regular sampling to ensure quality.
    * Flexibility in operation enhances usability in different settings.
    * Combines automatic detection with manual oversight for optimal results.

* Overall, the invention improves cigarette production processes.
    * Integrates advanced technology for monitoring and e

<summary>
